characters: LERNER, CRAWFORD, MANNY, FLASH, FRANCIS, HOYT, TUBBS, DOC
A QUOTATION AGAINST A BLACK SCREEN

dialogues.speaker: A QUOTATION AGAINST A BLACK SCREEN
dialogues.text: 'Rejoice, O young man, in thy youth...' The sound now of a C-130 air cargo plane roaring over us we cut sharply to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the C-130 coasts to a stop, the hatch rotating down on hot, dusty lifeless airstrip somewhere in Vietnam. Nothin seems to live or move in the midday sun.

dialogues.speaker: TITLES RUN
dialogues.text: A DOZEN NEW RECRUITS step off the plane, unloading their  duffel bags, looking around like only the new can look ar their hair regulation-clipped, crisp, new green fatigues  fitting them like cardboard. CHRIS TAYLOR is just another one of them - as he turns in a tight closeup, to look at a motorized cart pulling up  alongside... He's about 21. New meat. His face, unburned by the sun, is tense, bewildered, innocent, eyes searchin for the truth. They fall now on a heap of BODY BAGS in the back of the c Two soldiers begin loading them onto the plane. Flies -  hundreds of flies - buzz around them, the only cue to the contents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (next to Chris,  Southern accent) That what I think it is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a look) I guess so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An uncomfortable look between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, let's go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they move out, Chris' eyes moving with the body bags b loaded onto the plane. Moving over now to a motley HALF D VETERANS bypassing them on their way to the plane. They l happy. Very happy, chatting it up. They pass the newboys - and they shake their heads, their eyes full of an almost mocking pity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I'll be dipped in shit - new  meat! Sorry bout that boys - 'sin  loi' buddy... You gonna love the  Nam, man, for-fucking-ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris looking at them. They pass, except for the last man who walks slower than the rest, a slight limp. His eyes f on Chris. They're frightening eyes, starved, hollow, sunken deep in his face, black and dangerous. The clammy pallor of malar clings to him as he looks at Chris through decayed black  teeth. Then the sun flares out on him and he's past. And  Chris looks back. Disturbed. It's as if the man was not r For a moment there. As if he were a ghost. Chris walking, duffel bag on the shoulder, looks up at th lollipop sun burning a hole through the sky. A rushing SO now. Of frightening intensity, an effect combining the bl of an airplane with the roar of a lion as we hardcut to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun matches the intensity of the previous shot as we  move down into thick green jungle. We hear the sound of M coming, a lot of men. The thwack of a machete. Brush bein bulled. We wait. They are getting close. The CREDITS continue to run. SUBTITLE reads: December 1967 - Bravo Company, 25th Infan Division - Somewhere near the Cambodian Border. A sweating white face comes into view. CHRIS - cutting po Machete in one hand, whacking out a path for the platoon, 16 in the other, he looks like he's on the verge of heat  exhaustion. Breathing too hard, pacing himself all wrong, bumping into things, tripping, not quite falling, he look pathetic here in the naturalness of the jungle. An urban  transplant, slightly neurotic and getting more so. His rucksack is coming apart as well, about 70 badly pack pounds banging noisily. Behind him BARNES now comes, the Platoon Sergeant. Then t RTO, his radio man, humming lightly. Others are behind, t column snaking back deep into the brush. We cut around some FACES of the Platoon - all to be seen  later. Young faces, hard and dirty after weeks in the fie exhausted yet alert, fatigues filthy, slept-in, torn,  personalized, hair way past regulation length, medals,  bandannas. A jungle army. Boys. Chris glancing down at his raw bleeding blisters. Transfe the machete to his other, slightly less blistered, hand. kid cuts on - struggling but trying, on his last reserves strength, smashing almost straight forward through brush, not even bothering to look ahead. He smells something, lo around, slows his pace, eyes working... around to the bas of a tree. He moves past it. And as he does so, the camera from his POV comes around o dead decomposing 10-day-old GOOK - eyes starting from its sockets, worms and flies feasting. Chris draws his breath in, terrified. Barnes suddenly app alongside, his hard humourless eyes looking annoyed from gook to Chris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you waiting for? He ain't  gonna bite you. Move out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris looks at him with pent-up hatred and crashes on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the COMPANY PC, CAPTAIN HARRIS on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bravo Two, Six. What's the delay up  there, move it out on point. We've  got a link up at Phase Line Whiskey  at One Eight Zero Zero, over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the PLATOON PC, LIEUTENANT WOLFE sweats heavily as he  speaks in his radio. He is also new to the field, a dark  little feisty guy, about 24, very hairy, especially in th eyebrows, an intense get-ahead look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two Bravo, Two move it out. Six says  we're jamming 'em up back there.   Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnes, upfront, turns to SAL, his radio man, under his  breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell that dipshit to get fucked.   Get that other freshmeat up here.   Gardner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Barnes picks up his pace, irritated now at this reprim from the CO - coming up on Chris, who is soaked now from  head to foot in sweat, dizzy, feeling sick, about to vomi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's the matter with you  Taylor! You a sorry ass motherfucker.  Fall back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs Chris's machete out of his hand and bulls his wa into the foliage, tearing it apart, setting a new pace. Chris being bypassed by the column, their eyes on him. He swatting at the red ants that are all over his neck. GARDNER, another new recruit, fat, hustling up to replace him. A big and black medic - DOC - comes over, gentle eyes and manner; with him is Sergeant ELIAS, concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ants. I got ants on my neck... (shaking them out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (helping him) Yeah, black ants are killers, you  look sick man. You need a little  salt. (reaching into his  satchel)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sergeant Elias, a handsome, graceful dark-haired Indian k of 23, the squad sergeant, is taking items out of Chris'  pack - air mattress, extra unnecessary clothing, extra  canteens, grenades, gas mask, books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his head,  amused) You're humping way too much, troop,  don't need half this shit. I'll haul  it for you but next time you check  it out with me okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris nodding, grateful, panting. The men passing, watching. Chris sorry about this, trying keep up face. BUNNY, a young 18 year-old with an angel's face, is pissi in the dead gook's face. KING passes, glances at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a sick mother Bunny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bunny laughing about it. Chris standing there one moment, fighting for his breath, suddenly passes out, going over with his 70 pound rucksac hitting the ground with a loud bang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (concerned) Hold it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Chris - his eyes opening. He seems all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to get up) I'm okay... I'm okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris crumples backwards. Elias helps him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The COMPANY - about 100 men who seem insignificant amid t size of the surrounding jungle - is digging into a perime of some 100-yard radius. A RESUPPLY CHOPPER lifts off in flurry of blowing leaves. Bare-chested soldiers chop down trees, clear fields of fire, set out claymores, fill sand chow down. Little fires snake up against the greying red  horizon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We cut close on a pair of grungy feet - the staple of the infantry - moving up to DOC, the Medic, bandaging them fo FU SHENG, a Hawaiin kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhah sets his tripflare. Crawford, with him, putting out claymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back in the perimeter RODRIGUEZ sets his M-60 in the newl dug foxhole. SAL, next to him, is shaving in his helmet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KING looks like a king. A lion of a black man but with a  sleepy, gentle face, not to be roused, is painfully tryin to scrawl a letter home with the pencil held awkwardly,  mouthing the words. FRANCIS, a young baby-faced black wit long lashes and soft eyes, peeks over his shoulder, shaki his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, King, it ain't d-e-r-e man,  it's d-e-a-r, and Sara don't have no  two r's in it, fool. Shame on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: King shrugs, a sleepy stoned voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't matter, she knows what it  means... an she don't read too good  nohow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sgt. Elias washes himself, attentive to his body, slender and well-muscled, and extremely handsome youth. Of Indian blood, with long black hair, generous smile, wide facial  bone structure, gypsy eyes, and the cleanest white teeth, could be a young Greek god. He is given somewhat to panac a silver wristband on his arm, a bandanna of black parach silk hanging from his neck, his fatigues tightened down a the ankle, he pulls his pants down, checking for crotch r applying talcum powder to the area, his buttocks facing u LERNER, a white kid, 19, from Florida, stopping to admire the frontal view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mumm, any time sweetheart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lerner, you'd choke to death on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the COMPANY COMMAND POST a beehive of activity with it four radios, personnel, some Vietnamese scouts milling ar CAPTAIN HARRIS is running down a field map with his THREE LIEUTENANTS. Harris, a broad-shouldered fine-looking mili specimen with the requisite Southern accent and football  coach mannerism, is directing his remark to 2nd Platoon's LT. WOLFE, who looks a little nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sky Six reports a fresh company of  NVA moving across from Cambodia to  this blue line. (points to position) We got a good chance to light 'em up  tonight. All platoons will set squad- size ambushes before full dark. Lt.  Wolfe (glances at him) You 'bush in this area near that ol'  Buddhist temple we passed on the  hump in. Lt. Hawkins, you take this  area in the rubber plantation...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eager) No problem sir...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elsewhere, Chris scrapes out a foxhole, his shirt off,  bandanna around his head, the work hot and heavy. TEX is out there setting the claymore as BIG HAROLD and J start breaking down their C's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a whining high voice) Hey Big Harold, gimme your peaches  for the fruitcake man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughes loudly) Fuck you bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon man, didn't I do you right  that time I give you the turkey loaf  for the ham and lima beans shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tricky bitch, reason you gimme dat  turkey loaf is nobody else can eat  that shit 'cept me so don't start  your game playing with me Junior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're both black, Junior with huge goggle eyes and a fa of pimples and pockmarks, his teeth yellowed and decayed, some of them missing. Harold is about twice his size, abo 250 pounds, a baby huey concentrating real hard on prepar his stove to eat with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Youse a pig man. I hope Manny get  dat laundry gig for' you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: De fool think he's gonna get it but  he ain't known for his thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a fool alright but you a bigger  fool. Hey, whiteboy, watcha waiting  for - dat hole ain't gonna dig  itself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris looks up, continues working, as Junior chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Taylor, you don't know it but I  saved your ass today. I killed a  shit-eating dog. (laughing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting up) That reminds me, I gotta take a shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna wipe your ass dis time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah if you let me have your shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (VOICE OVER, as he  digs) Somebody once wrote Hell is the  impossibility of Reason. That's what  this place feels like. I hate it  already and it's only been a week.   Some goddamn week, grandma... (checking his raw  blisters) ...the hardest thing I think I've  ever done is to go on point, 3 times  this week - I don't even know what  I'm doing. A gook could be standing  3 feet in front of me and I wouldn't  know it, I'm so tired. We get up at  5 a.m., hump all day, camp around 4  or 5 p.m., dig foxhole, eat, then  put out an all-night ambush or a 3- man listening post in the jungle.   It's scary cause nobody tells me how  to do anything cause I'm new and  nobody cares about the new guys,  they don't even want to know your  name. The unwritten rule is a new  guy's life isn't worth as much cause  he hasn't put his time in yet - and  they say if you're gonna get killed  in the Nam it's better to get it in  the first few weeks, the logic being:  you don't suffer that much. I can  believe that... If you're lucky you  get to stay in the perimeter at night  and then you pull a 3-hour guard  shift, so maybe you sleep 3-4 hours  a night, but you don't really sleep...  I don't think I can keep this up for  a year, grandma - I think I've made  a big mistake coming here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he speaks, we cut around to various shots of the plato members on the perimeter - shaving, eating, cooking, play etc...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Towards the end of this voice over, we cut to Sgt. BARNES moving towards the PLATOON PC. A powerful face, a quiet,  angry fixed stare, a thick trimmed moustache that helps  conceal a network of plastic surgery grafts and scars. Th distortion from the jaw up the left side of his face to h forehead, punctuated by a severe indentation above the le eye where a bullet once penetrated his skull. Walking with him is Sgt. O'NEILL as they join WOLFE, Sgts ELIAS and WARREN at the PLATOON PC where they're huddled  over maps. Warren is a black, thin, tall, paranoid man wi untrusting eyes, silent and bitter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to all, almost pleased  about it) We got boo-coo movement. 3rd Battalion  just got hit 15 kliks north of here. (the MEN react with  wary silence)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eager to elaborate) Yeah, they had claymores strung up  in the trees, blew a whole fucking  platoon to pieces. BAAD SHIT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnes inflects his next words at Wolfe, who is worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, they got two Lieutenants and a  Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elias quiet. Barnes studying the map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Barnes) Who do you want on ambush, Sergeant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnes doesn't bother acknowledging the question, barely  glancing at the Lieutenant, to him a necessary evil. Ever knows who's really in charge of the Platoon. Barnes flick his gaze to Elias.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elias - you take your squad and I'll  take Tex and Francis from your squad. (to Warren) We move out in two-zero mikes. (concluding)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought it was O'Neill's turn  tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all look at each other. O'Neill spits in the dust, a freckled, short red head with a hard worried face, a life 30 going on 60.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! Morehouse and Sal are short.  Fu Sheng's going on R&R, you don't  want to send their asses out on an  ambush. You got the fresh meat Elias.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Barnes) They don't know shit Barnes, and  chances are we gonna run into  something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what am I going to do! Get one of  my guys zapped so some fuckface fresh  from the World can get his beauty  fucking sleep!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey O'Neill why don't you cool it,  you don't have to be a prick everyday  of your life, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you Elias.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get your men ready Elias ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Concluding the debate, no further argument, Barnes rises. The meeting's closed. Lt. Wolfe hasn't said a word, looki as Elias departs, without a word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (watching him) Fucking guy's got 3 years in and he  thinks he's Cochise or something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His resentment directed partly at the way in which Elias  carries himself, the natural sense of grace - and the dig it bestows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later. On the very edge of the perimeter, darkness coming down fast, the men in the ambush patrol rustle into their packs, all of them bitching. Tex, carrying the M-60, looks up at the glowering sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, looks like rain. All night  too. Gonna grow mushrooms in your  bad-ass crotch Junior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Goddamn ain't no justice round here,  you break your ass for de white man...  gonna get our act together, do some  rappin' wid de brothers, change  things...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's O'Neill have a nose up the  lieutenant's ass already, how come  we always get ambush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Politics, man, politics. We always  getting fucked around here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris is scared, nervous with his last-minute equipment  adjustments, his pack obviously overweight for a night mi as he hauls it up. Gardner, the other new boy, is jovial in contrast, his wa extended towards Chris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Chris, I show you a picture of  Lucy Jean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not to be bothered) No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gardner shows him his girl. She's real dog u-g-l-y, and w makes it worse is Gardner's put the standard photo of Raq Welch alongside it, tits and all. But he misses the irony it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (admiring) Yeah she's the one all right... that's  Lucy Jean. She's a-waiting for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding) Yeah she's real pretty, you're  lucky...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gardner puts it away. Elias appears alongside them, check their packs out, takes out Chris's poncho liner and other items. He carries a modified M-16 with a short barrel and collapsible stock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to both boys) Don't need this or this... you're  doing okay. Just stick close to Tex,  do what he does. (calling out to Tex) Tex you got Junior and Taylor here  on your position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tex is a sour Texas Ranger type, chews tobacco, spits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn, 'Lias this gun's boss. Put  Taylor someplace else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris feels the words like lashes on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got Taylor... (to Gardner) ...Gardner you go with me (to Chris and Gardner) 'Case somethin' happens to you, you  get separated or lost don't yell out  okay. Sit tight. We'll get to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes. Chris watching them. A smile in them. Elias mov off, a quality to the man that Chris admires. A natural s of leadership.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, let's move out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he follows King, on point, out the perimeter. A single file.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. THE AMBUSH NIGHT, (RAIN)
dialogues.text: Night is coming down. The tone of the jungle sounds has s shifted - mellower, more sinuous and certainly scarier. The file stops. King, an experienced point man, listens. Chris - carrying Tex's linked ammo - looks around, tense. Behind him is Gardner, trying to smile, starts to whisper something ('Hey Taylor...') when he's abruptly shushed. The file moves on. Gardner's pack rattling a little too l A weird rush of cold wind now rattles the trees and the  MONSOON comes. A hard slanting rain, sudden, tropic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A piece of an old Buddhist temple, under a sulky moonligh now in a state of decay, the jungle surging to engulf it. The Men are setting up quickly and relatively quietly in ruins - alongside a minuscule trail. The rain is coming d harder than ever. Chris and Tex setting out their claymore mines, raveling  back their detonating cords to their position, drenched. the far distance, an ILLUMINATION ROUND brightens the sky for a brief moment. Various ad lib curses and directions lost in the sound of the rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the Ambush CP, Ace whipsers into his radio. A soft his sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later. Close on Chris being shaken awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taylor, you're on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (groggy) Uh hunh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rain continuing to pelt them. Tex hands him an infrar scope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suspicious) You sure you know how to work the  claymore?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (offended) Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tex curls up as best he can in his poncho to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... don't catch no zzz's on me  buddy or I'll sling your motherfucking  ass... You hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grits his teeth) Yeah. (looking at his watch) Hey Tex - you're ten minutes fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sin Loi. ('tough luck', closes  his teeth) Chris lets it go, scans the jungle  and trail with the scope. The POV is  greasy and blurred. He puts it aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly a series of resonant SNORES crack through the ju Chris starts, then sees it's from JUNIOR lying out there, spreadeagled in the rain. Chris prods him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junior!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unh?... Unh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shaddup! You're snoring... Shhh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bending low into his eardrum. Junior never wakes, rolls o with a growl. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later. A pool of muddy water has formed, in which a pair buttocks sit. Move up to Chris still on duty, looking at watch, drawn, drenched, pathetic, rainwater coursing down his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing his letter) ...'Course Mom and Dad didn't want  me to come, they wanted me to be  just like them - respectable, hard- working, making $200 a week, a little  house, a family. They drove me crazy  with their goddamn world, grandma,  you know Mom, I don't want to be a  white boy on Wall Street, I don't  want my whole life to be predetermined  by them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large RIPPING SOUND as the wind blows down a big tree b onto the jungle floor. He starts, peering out. Nothing. H looks at his watch again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I guess I have always been  sheltered and special, I just want  to be anonymous. Like everybody else.  Do my share for my country. Live up  to what Grandpa did in the First War  and Dad the Second. I know this is  going to be the war of my generation.   Well here I am - anonymous all right,  with guys nobody really cares about -  they come from the end of the line,  most of 'em, small towns you never  heard of - Pulaski, Tennessee,  Brandon, Mississippi, Pork Bend,  Utah, Wampum, Pennsylvania. Two years'  high school's about it, maybe if  they're lucky a job waiting for 'em  back in a factory, but most of 'em  got nothing, they're poor, they're  the unwanted of our society, yet  they're fighting for our society and  our freedom and what we call America,  they're the bottom of the barrel -  and they know it, maybe that's why  they call themselves 'grunts' cause  a 'grunt' can take it, can take  anything. They're the backbone of  this country, grandma, the best I've  ever seen, the heart and soul - I've  found it finally, way down here in  the mud - maybe from down here I can  start up again and be something I  can be proud of, without having to  fake it, maybe... I can see something  I don't yet see, learn something I  don't yet know... I miss you, I miss  you very much, tell Mom I miss her  too - Chris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves towards Junior, shakes him, but Junior seems to out of this world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junior opens one dead eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your shift, man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junior scowls, swears, looks around for his rifle in the  mud. Chris crawls back to his position, curling himself up in soaked poncho, teeth chattering from the cold, rain  splattering over him. A long beat. He sighs, the sigh kic off the next image.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris jerks awake - very suddenly, very frightened. THE R HAS STOPPED. The jungle sounds are loud. Cicadas, night  animals, water dripping hypnotically from leaf to leaf. A the whirr of a million mosquitoes out after the rains, ch at Chris' face. He looks around, startled. Tex is asleep. Junior is asleep. What happened? He looks his watch. The mosquitoes are eating him alive. He buries his head in his green towel which he wears around his nec but he can't see. A beat. He moves again, miserable from bites. Another beat. Then suddenly the sounds of the jung shift - some of the animals dropping out. A different ton A piece of wood is stepped on, a rustle of bush... Chris sees something, lifts an edge of the towel to peek  out. A shadow of a figure is frozen there in front of him abou 15 yards. It looks like a man. But it doesn't move. At al It listens. Chris, his heart in his mouth, tries to peer through it.  It's a bush. It has to be. No human being could stand tha still. His heartbeats are up. The moments take forever. B deep down - somewhere in his psyche - he knows who it is. The figure now shifts, ever so slightly - and moves. It I human being. Oh my God! Chris looks around. Tex seems like a mile away. Why doesn anyone fire! He casts a desperate look at his rifle, at h grenades encrusted with mud, but in spite of all his trai he is frozen with indecision and fear at the sight of his enemy. The figure seems to whisper something back, then turns an comes down the trail. Now a second and third figure appea behind him - all in helmets and packs. All coming right p Chris' position. Ten yards. Nine. Chris is rigid with terror. Stark eyes. Pleading with Tex wake up, but out of reach. He is about to have an anxiety attack, his heartbeats so far up he is sure they will hea him. The first figure is now directly in front of Chris on the trail, looking left and right. A rattle of his equipment, creak of leather. A smell. The man's face now catches the moonlight and his eyes come around on Chris. Oriental eyes. Looking right at him. Startled. Chris star back, hypnotized. It all happens very fast. The figure mu something in Vietnamese. A warning. He swivels. A flash of muzzle fire. A raking cough of automatic fire. grenade explosion. Chris is hurled to the ground, helmet bouncing off, scatt confused, jarred. All hell breaks loose around him with N and SHOUTS. Tex, kissing the ground, is yelling at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CLAYMORE! GET THOSE FUCKERS!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris, not knowing what he's doing, is fumbling with the  claymore handles, presses them. INSERT: They won't give. tries again and again to the squeeze the life out of them Tex is screaming at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE SAFETY! TAKE THE SAFETY OFF YOU...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lunges over and grabs the handle from Chris. Clicks the  safeties off and blows them. Three EXPLOSIONS rip out into the night - and one of the  ENEMY is caught in a brief instant looking like an X-ray, his body lifted and swirling in the air, then enveloped i swirls of smoke. Chris, trying to keep up, grabs his M-16, lays out a stre of fire. The sound all around him is deafening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gardner, freaking out, stands crouched, confused, tries t run, collapses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Neill throws a grenade, wild.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An explosion. Chris hits the deck. Tex is now on the M-60 machine gun, yelling at Junior who cringing on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feed me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lays out red tracer bullets like laser beams, then sud reels back, whiplashed, screaming. A grenade explosion ro them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AAAAAGHHH! MY ARM! MY ARM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His hand and wrist are gone, his face in the dirt. Junior fumbling around, trying to stay down and help him at the  same time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing Tex's gun) DOC! GET UP HERE! TEX IS HIT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris, looking out to his front, has no clue what's going on. Except the fire is slacking. Relayed shouts of 'Medic Medic!' Other SHOUTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOLD IT UP! HOLD IT UP!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The firing has ceased. A silence, punctuated by occasiona shouts and fast moments, has enveloped once more the ceme Doc crashes through the bush, kneels over Tex, who contin to howl in deep pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (freaked out) MY ARM! JESUS FUCKING CHRIST!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy Tex easy boy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trying to sound calm but his voice is on the edge, examin the mutilation with a pen flashlight, he whips out his  morphine in a big hypodermic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (next position) Doc over here! Gardner's hit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Right there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he slips the morphine into Tex's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muttering at Chris) ...godamn! Godamn! DUMB FUCKER, DUMB  FUCKER!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris watching, suddenly feels himself dizzy, instinctive runs his hands over the back of his neck. Feels the warm  blood there. A moan comes from his lips. Junior looks at  him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit, Doc he's hit too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weakly) I'm hit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnes and Big Harold come hustling up. Doc finishes tourniquetting Tex, cradles Chris onto the e his flashlight probing the wound. Tex in background conti to thrash and moan. Chris waits, tensely for the verdict, his eyes big with f on Doc, who takes out his morphine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Barnes, pointing  at Chris) That dumb fuck didn't blow his  claymore!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris hearing this. Barnes looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Chris) ...it's a scratch, nothing to worry  about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suspicious) Doc... tell me the truth, don't lie  to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The needle goes in. Tex lets out this strange keening moa that sets everyone's teeth on edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Barnes) He let 'em walk right up on us. He  was sleeping on his shift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muttering weakly) I was not... it was your...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leaving, to Harold  and Junior) Self-preservation's the first law of  nature. Gotta learn how to work your  shit Taylor. Watch me, don't let 'em  go into shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tex's moans are maddening and scary. Barnes suddenly clam his hand over Tex's mouth shutting him up and from way do deep in his throat, chokes out the words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up! Shut up - and TAKE IT! TAKE  THE PAIN!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tex's eyes roll wildly, uncomprehending. Doc and Big Haro looking at Barnes, wondering. Tex is suddenly silent, sho Barnes stands, an icy glare, goes. Junior scrambles over Tex's side. Doc runs off. Big Harold cradles Chris, his big black hands like a moth reassuring him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna be okay Taylor, okay, don't  you start worrying now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris looking up at him, eyes blinking slowly, dazed alre by the morphine. He's very scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you... do you know you're gonna  die... Big Harold?... do you feel  like... like... everything's gonna  be fine and then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit man, you gettin outta the  field, man. Three hots a day, white  sheets, dem pretty white nurses give  you blowjobs too you pay em enough,  I heard tell bout dem white bitches.   Better save yo strength Taylor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muttering darkly) Don babytalk him man. Cocksucker  fell asleep. They walked right up on  us, he don do shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shaddup bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris is gettin woozier, feeling he is dying but starting grin, not caring about it anymore. Yet he is nowhere clos to dying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not... so bad... dying. How  long... it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnes stands over a moaning, ripped up ENEMY SOLDIER. FI his M-16 point blank into the head. The Soldier bucks and dies, quivering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELIAS, checking out a blood trail some distance away, shi on the shot, looks back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANCES, MANNY, BUNNY and KING are huddled over another  mangled enemy corpse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stripping the corpse) That's no NVA man. That's a chink -  look at 'em, the cocksucker's six  and a half feet tall. Look at his  gear - good as ours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit I blew my claymore right in one  dude's face and I seen him walking  around afterwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What we fighting here, vampires?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elias comes up to Barnes swiftly, indicating the blood tr leading off into the bush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood trail just keeps going and  going but no body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the hell did he get away?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckers returned fire soon as we lit  'em up. Hard core fuckin' NVA. They  got their shit together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coming up to Barnes) Sarge - Doc wants you. There's a  problem with the new man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elias and Barnes go with King. Past Chris and Tex who are ambulatory and bandaged, being helped along. As Barnes pa the men look at him, everybody quickly senses something i wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At one of the positions Doc is working feverishly to knoc the life back into Gardner who lies there, his shirt stri off on his cottage cheese belly. A huge sucking chest wou He's dying. You know it because he knows it. The eyes do talking, numb, terrorized yet strangely detached, accepti not protesting or concerned any longer. Most of the ambush has assembled and is watching, Chris m in to see. Doc is mumbling to him, low key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chopper's on the way Gardner, hang  in there, you gonna be okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Gardner seems unconcerned. Things are going on in his head - who knows what. And in his eyes there are big tear rolling. Then a morphine smile. A sort of goofy Gardner s maybe thinking about Lucy Jean, who knows. He's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to all) Take a good look at this lump  o'shit... (motions to Gardner's  body) Rmember what it looks like, all of  you. You fuck up in a firefight and  I guaran-goddamn-tee you, a trip out  of the bush - IN A BODYBAG. Out here,  assholes, you keep your shit wired  tight at ALL times... (glares directly at  Chris) and that goes for you, shit for  brains. You don't SLEEP ON NO FUCKIN'  AMBUSH. Next sonofabitch I catch  coppin' z's in the bush I'm personally  gonna take an interest in seeing him  suffer - I SHIT YOU NOT...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He thumps Chris lightly but menacingly in his chestbone a moves on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (drowsy) I didn't fall asleep, Sergeant,  Junior...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pissed, cuts in,  shoves him hard) Shut your face chicken shit! You in  big trouble boy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuses are like assholes, Taylor -  everybody got one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knock it off! We got two men need  attention here. Police up your extra  ammo and frags, don't leave nothing  for the dinks. Hoyt, Junior, carry  Gardner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muttering) Let de white boy carry his ass, he  this dude that got him fucked up.   Who'd be hauling his ass if that was  a brother laying there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elias follows Barnes out of earshot of the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man'd be alive if he'd had a few  more days to learn something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnes, registering it, just keeps on walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris is driven up in a jeep to his Company PC - marked ' PC' on a C-ration box. It's midday on a hot lazy afternoo few people out in the 102 degree sun. Chris' Company is on the outskirts of the base camp, thei barracks regulation wood, canvas, and fine mesh screening red dust everywhere, bunkers down on the perimeter, reams barbed wire and concertina, a sand-bagged MESS HALL and  CHAPEL, 81 mm mortar pits, observation towers, recoilless rifles, 50-caliber machine guns. Chris gets out of the jeep, stiff-necked, a bandage aroun it, still in some pain.  The first man he intersects is K carrying crates of beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Taylor, what's in the breeze?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In King's mild tone Chris tries to read his standing in t platoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay - got light duty, three days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, too bad we in base camp anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you got there - beers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, just stole me some from the  Top's supply but he's stealing it  from us anyway. (sees somebody coming) Chucks are coming. You better 'didi'  man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too late. Sgt. O'NEILL, the redhead lifer accompanied by  Spec 4 SANDERSON, a big handsome blond kid, not too brigh in the face, both slightly drunk, come around a corner, b cans in hand. O'Neill sees Chris immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Taylor - you back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause) Uh, looks like it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (spotting King's beer) Where'd you get that beer King?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a funny look) I found it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You found it?... Bullshit!  You going  on report. Gimmee that shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awright, come here both of you. You  too Taylor (wags his finger) Got a little special job for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They advance toward him reluctantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got light duty, Sarge. Doctor said  to take it easy couple days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughes) ...ain't that tough shit now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wooden cabin with some half-dozen seats built over half barrels cut from empty oil drums. A guy is in there, pull up his pants. Chris, King and Crawford, a California blond with a hands honeyed look, are sweating heavily as they roll the barre out from under the outhouse, the smell of human waste str A hot midday emptiness, nobody around except the flies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pissed) ...Motherfuckah, motherfuckah, I'm  too short to be dealing with this  shit! They keep fucking with us man,  no letup...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (equally pissed) Politics man, fuckin' politics. That  O'Neill man got his nose so far up  Top's ass he gotta be Pinocchio...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forty-two days man and a wakeup and  I'm a gone motherfucker. Back to de  WORLD. (dreaming in his eyes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Broke a 100. Got 92 to go. April 17.  DEROS man. California this summer.  Waves are good they tell me, surfin's  gonna be good...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: March man in Tennessee, sniff the  pines... sniff that crossmounted  pussy walkin' down by the river.   What you got Taylor? (a snicker) Let's see three hundred and WHAT?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (groans) Oh man! Sorry bout that. I can't  even remember when I was 332. You  gotta count backwards like you got  40 days in - think positive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Chris) How the fuck you get over here man,  you look like you educated...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I volunteered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You WHAT? Say 'gain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I dropped out of college and  told 'em I wanted infantry, combat,  and Nam...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grins, finding their reactions funny. It's also the fi time we've seen Chris crack a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You volunteered for this shit man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You a crazy fucker, givin' up college  man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: King has long sleepy eyelids and cat's eyes, a large pink tongue and big white-edged cotton picker's nails - a lazy gentle nature, content with the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't make much sense. Wasn't  learning anything... (hesitates) And why should just the poor kids go  to the war - and the college kids  get away with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: King and Crawford share a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What we got here a crusader?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pause, wipe the sweat off. King lighting up a half-s joint, hitting a few puffs, eyes shooting around, making  sure he's not spotted, passing it to Crawford.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheeit, gotta be rich in the first  place to think like dat. Everybody  know the poor always being fucked by  the rich. Always have, always will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noticing Chris is having trouble with his neck, picking a his bandage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay man? Neck botherin' you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here have some of this. Won't feel a  thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris looking at the joint, a little apprehensive. He's n smoked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thanks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on, whatcha gotta lose, yo' here  now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kills the smell of shit anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The joint proferred. Chris waits a beat, shrugs, takes it smokes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suck it in. Hold it... That's it.  Now let it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris blows it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't feel it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: King and Crawford chuckle, go on rolling the cans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dat's what they all say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: King, Crawford and Chris pour kerosene over the cans at a secure distance from the outhouse. King lights it. The cans pop and start crackling. A line burning barrels. Rings of dirty black smoke rise against soft blue sky. They watch, stoned. Chris turns to both of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...you know that night we got hit...  I... (ashamed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck it, don't mean nothing, no such  thing here as a coward, done your  best man, next time y'do better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: History, man, history.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris surprised at their attitude. The joint suddenly hit him, a look in his face, eyes looking around different.   Over at King.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deadpans) I think I'm starting to feel that  stuff...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crawford laughes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) Yo getting there Taylor. You be cool  now and I'll introduce you 'round to  some of the 'heads'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are the heads?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughes, walks away  with Crawford) Later...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris alone, breathes deep, feeling the full effect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A relief against the long harsh, hot day. We see lights o all over the camp, sounds of music, laughter from the  barracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: King leads Chris down to a specially constructed cellar-l hutch dug deep into the ground on an isolated edge of the battalion perimeter. Ammo casing and canvas are piled ove it, and sandbags surround it. From the outside very littl sound can be heard as they go down through a trap door ma of ammo crates. Past a lookout (Adams) pulling security,  hitting a joint but alert. King motions to him, it's cool Inside is another world. Chris looking around amazed. It' like a private cabaret for the 'heads' who are there cool out. Boxes of food from the States, beers, whiskey bottle crates functioning as tables, hammocks hanging from poles electric fans, tape decks, paraphernalia. The boys are all dressed up in their Saturday night rags. The clothes are clean, the headbands, the medallions are  out, anything distinctive and individualistic. On the  tapedeck, Jefferson Airplane's 'Go Ask Alice'. To Chris it is a new world. And RHAH, the resident head,  sitting there in all his finery puffing a huge burning re bowl in a three foot long Montagnard pipe, seems to be th lord of final judgment in this smoky underworld. Across his naked chest, birds and snakes are tattooed. Ar his neck a black skull and white ivory cross side by side On his knuckles 'Love' and 'Hate' are tattooed. In his ey a dancing Satanic fire. A poor rural Southern white, in h grizzled late 20's, he could be a Biker King. Giving Chri the once-over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatcha doing in the underworld  Taylor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) This ain't Taylor. Taylor been shot.  This man Chris been resurrected...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris wondering what he's doing here. His eyes roving ove

dialogues.speaker: LERNER, CRAWFORD, MANNY, FLASH, FRANCIS, HOYT, TUBBS, DOC
dialogues.text: other from the Platoon, about 9 or 10 of them. Rhah eyes him back, hands him the bowl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lame Taylor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lame or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) ...go ahead on, smoke it man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris understands, takes the bowl. Hesitates. Then smokes it. The contact fumes are almost enough to knock him out. He starts coughing. They're all laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your shit's in the wind troop.   Baaaaah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lerner replies, his tongue hanging out in parody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Baaaaaaa! back on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at Lerner  with distaste) If you're gonna do it man, 'least do  it right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Building up to it, his eyes shaking with conviction at th whole insanity of the world, he neighs with all the venom can muster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all laugh and applaud. King smoking from the pipe pa it back to Chris who takes another hit, doesn't cough thi time, looking around, wondering about these guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bah, you're a child, Lerner. Rhah  don't waste time on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They go on ad-libbing with each other, teasing Doc, who's fairly straight, saying he wants to go to med school in t fall. 'Be what?''A gynecologist, man.''What dat?' Francis suggests, 'Dats a pussy doctor, man - he's gonna be Docto Feelgood, man!' They're all cracking up, finding every jo funny. As Chris finishes his hit on the pipe, looks up ac the smoke, already dazed, surprised to see ELIAS suddenly there - leaning out of his sling in a far corner of the h A Monkey is draped around his neck with silver bracelets, rings, a necklace - like a sensual little Egyptian whore, Elias playing with it, spaced out in a sleeveless vest, t pants. Dancing eyes on Chris, he swings out the hammock,  comes over with the monkey. Meanwhile Manny has broken into a high falsetto snatch of blues directed at Chris, joined by Big Harold and Francis all of them clicking their hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oooh Chris, you look like you is  high oh yeah, he looks like he is  high Ooooh Chris, you know you gonna  be that way all night oh yeah I think  that you are... Yeah! up now and up  to par oh yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elias pulls out a Remington 870 shotgun, jacks it to the  rear, points it at Chris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put your mouth on that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris does so slowly, a little worried. Elias takes a hit and blows it down the bore - 'shotgunning' it into Chris' lungs. Chris staggers back, coughing. Everybody laughs 'h dude - you done had your ass blown away' etc... Elias smiles his big white-tooth smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then the worm has definately turned  for you man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris puzzled by this expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) Feel good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a sense of euphoria  now) Yeah. No pain in my neck now. Feels  good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feelin' good's good enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he sucks in a huge mass of smoke off the bowl. His eye performing a funny little hop, skip and jump, as he holds it, his face turning red. The monkey jabbers and jumps around on his neck, worried. Elias then blows the smoke out in its face, the monkey ha it. The Group laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Crutcher. I hear you got a Dear  John from your gal. Told you she  wasn't getting 'nuff from you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lerner looks up, stoned out of his mind, wearing a ring i his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. Sold me out for some lame dude  with a 4-F.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you say her name was again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (recalling her image) Daisy Mae.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey look at Charlotte!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The monkey is sitting quietly stoned, its eyes blinking. Laughter off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy Mae! What Daisy Mae look like  Crutcher?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She look huge and got freckles on  her ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She look beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much she weigh man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She braid her hair under her armpits,  Crutcher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Daisy Mae what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Hey look at this! Ma and Pa Kettle  here. Look at them - greasy gook  motherfuckers!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get up out of there!... You see I  didn't wanna hurt you. Why didn't  you come out, when I said so hunh!  Why? WHY! WHY? DON'T YOU LISTEN...  WHAT ARE YOU SMILING AT HUNH! FUCKING  ASSHOLES!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The couple, hands raised, muttering things in Vietnamese, don't understand a word, shaking their heads stupidly and smiling that impassive Oriental smile which sends Chris i a rage only he can understand. His finger closes on the trigger of his 16. Francis, the baby-faced black, looks nervously, sensing t danger... Bunny amused, drawn in by Chris. O'Neill watche passively from the lip of the hutch. The Young Man continues to grin, not seeming to realize t degree of danger he's in, which is what Chris wants - a t sign of acquiescence. There is also the added element of  showing off his manhood in front of an audience now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do 'em man, do 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris. The trigger. He pulls. But he can't quite bring hi to kill. The bullets exploding in the dirt at the edges o the young man's foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (demonic) DANCE YOU ONE-LEGGED MOTHERFUCKER,  DANCE!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Young Man hops up and down in a reflex fear of the so of the bullets as they thud into the dirt. Yet his eyes r fixed on Chris in wonderment. Chris, firing out the magazine, seems to expend his blood He ceases, noticing - for the first time - the eyes of th Young Man. They aren't stupid - nor fearful - but filled  with resignation and despair - a despair that Chris, in  disgust of himself, recognizes. Chris lowers the rifle, silent. The Young Man's impassive face shines now with tears. Tha sad young look - as if death itself would've been a relea Chris turns his eyes away, an awkward sense of shame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leaves) Let's get out of here man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Bunny takes up the slack, moves forward on the young  man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Chris) You chickenshit man, they're laughing  at you, look at them faces. That's  the way a gook laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Young Man nodding affable to Bunny and mumbling  ingratiating words in Vietnamese.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah sure you are, you're real sorry  ain't you. You're just crying out  your hearts about Sandy and Sal and  Manny - they're laughing at us! Their  family is out there in the fucking  bush blowing us away and they're  laughing at us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checking out the  hutch) Forget it will ya, let's go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris standing there, watching, sensing something awful i going to come and unable to do anything about it. It come suddenly and without warning. Bunny is looking at O'Neill the Vietnamese couple are muttering something. In one flu move, Bunny swivels and with unbelievable savagery clubs young one-legged man in the side of the head with the but of his 16.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned) Hey what are you doing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucker!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The young man is groaning on the floor of the hutch. Bunn smashes him - again and again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's for Sandy! And this is for  Sal! And this is for fucking Manny!   This is for me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris watches, horrified. Never in his life has he seen  something so horrifying as this. And yet he does nothing. He is part of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stepping back,  examines what's left  of the head, amazed) Wow! You see his fucking head come  apart? Look at that... I never seen  brains like dat before.  Jesus fucking  Christ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Old Lady is shrieking, hovering over the body of her  son. Bunny studying her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betcha the old bitch runs the whole  show. Probably helped cut Manny's  throat. Probably cut my balls off if  she could. (to Chris) Come on, man, let's do her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She cowers from him. Chris steps back, horrified. As is  O'Neill, more puzzled than horrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hitting her again) Let's zap all these motherfuckers!   Let's do the whole village!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He backs out of the hutch, scared. Evidently Bunny is  temporarily insane. But he spots O'Neill, yells at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GET BACK HERE YOU FUCKING COWARD  O'NEILL. THIS IS FOR SANDY... THIS  IS FOR SANDY MAN! AND SAL! AND MANNY!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he clubs her to death. On Chris' face, blood and brain tissue flying up into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tiny knot of men are ringed around Barnes who is questi a sturdy-looking man who is the VILLAGE CHIEF. He has bee stripped of his shirt, scars all over his body, scared. H has his ID papers out, trembling, showing them to Lerner speaks some pidgen Vietnamese.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd he get these wounds?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lerner translates, the man talking back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says he was hit in a bombing raid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a dink fo sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask him what the weapons are doing  here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says they had no choice. The NVA  killed the old honcho when he said  no. He says the rice is theirs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit... who the hell was the  dink we just nailed on the riverbank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris and O'Neill come up, watch. Others coming from diff places - sensing the narrowing drama. But half the platoo is still at work in the village. We hear shouts, grenade  explosions, occasionally gunfire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...He says he doesn't know, NVA  haven't been around in a couple of  months. Maybe it was a scout or...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men around Barnes grumble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah sure it was. What about all  that fucking rice and the weapons...  who they for? (looking at the Village  Chief) Cocksucker knows what I'm saying...  don't you Pop? (a blank look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're goddamn right he does!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lerner translating. The Village Chief's WIFE is now on th scene, a middle-aged woman with angry features, yelling a Lerner trying to answer for her husband, a high-pitched  barrage of indignant words directed mostly at Barnes, and interspersed with the spitting of her betel nuts on the  ground. The Village Chief trying to talk her down. But things are definitely getting out of control. And the heat from the is only aggravating the situation, pounding down on the a in the drama, their fatigues soaked in sweat and anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally) He swears he doesn't know anything!  He hates the NVA but they come when  they want and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's lying through his teeth!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waste the fucker, then see who talks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the bitch saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overwhelmed) She's going on, I don't know - why  are we shooting the pigs, they're  farmers... they got to make a living,  all that crap...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Woman is still ranting when Barnes turns to her, quit casually levels his M-16, and puts a bullet in her head. She goes down as if pole-axed. A stunned pause. The Chief looking at his wife. The Villa in background reacting. Wolfe looking... Chris looking, shocked. Doc, possibly th straightest of them all, very uncomfortable. They are all shocked in some way, but do nothing against the power of  Barnes. Barnes walks over to the pig pen with the other  Villagers, very casually, confronts them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Lerner) Tell him he talks or I'm gonna waste  more of 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lerner shaken up, muttering to the Village Chief who is i shock, kneeling next to the body of his wife, muttering i high whine of pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead, Lerner, ask him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A group of Villagers huddle to one side. Lerner, shaken, is yelling at all of them, demanding an  answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't know Sarge, they don't  know! (half believes it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnes turns his attention on the other villagers, his  intentions apparent. Everybody feels them. They're next.  Barnes is unperturbed, very much in command of the situat no rage, no emotions expressed. Chris has never seen such a thing in his life - but can't react. Can't stop it, just watches it like he's not quite there. The same goes for Lieutenant Wolfe, for all of them. The  very outrageousness of Barnes' killing seems to quell all protest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sensing the impending  massacre) Hey Sarge can we get in on this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony advances, the hairy Italian kid from Boston.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go all the way, let's go for  it! Let's do the whole fucking  village. Come on, Sarge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris' eyes... Rodriguez next to him, is neutral but will Francis is hesitant. Fu Sheng and Junior are ready to go for it. Lt. Wolfe is  powerless, frozen. Sgt. Warren stepping up. The massacre is just about to br The Villagers know it, kneel in prayer, mutter. Barnes suddenly grabs and drags a young 19 year-old Woman the Village Chief's daughter, across the pen, throws her  down on her knees, in front of the stunned Village Chief. She's screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This his daughter, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lerner nods. Barnes pulls his .45, puts it alongside her  head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Village Chief) You lie... You Vee Cee... I caca ado  Vee Cee!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He chambers the .45, the Woman begging Barnes for her lif cradling his knees. He sticks the gun down above her skul Chris wanting to cry out, to do something - but can't! A FIGURE suddenly flares out in the sun, advancing on the It is Elias.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARNES!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnes looks around. They all look around. Elias walks right up to him, followed by his men - King,  Rhah, Crawford, others from the rear party. He looks arou The corpse of the Wife... the Young Daughter sobbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAT THE FUCK YOU DOING!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pissed) Stay out of this Elias. This ain't  your show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOU AIN'T A FIRING SQUAD, YOU PIECE  OF SHIT!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stock of his rifle swings up fast and hard smacking B full in the face, breaking two teeth. Barnes staggers back, hurt, bleeding. Elias is on him lik leopard. Battering him with his fists. They struggle in the dust, two titans, their faces equall consumed with rage, clawing, spitting, punching, kicking, pounding each other's skulls in the dirt. A dust storm sw around them, the men closing around like excited apes at bloodfeast. Most of the men seem to be pulling for Barnes - Chris jus watching neutral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREAK IT UP! ELIAS! BARNES!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they roll on, smashing each other's faces in. Both qu fast, agile, mean fighters. Sgts. O'Neill and Warren drag them apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're dead, you're fucking dead  Elias!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOU - you're going to fuckin' jail,  buddy, you ain't getting away with  this one!!!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right! All right! All right!!!   NOW BREAK IT UP. LET'S GO...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They compose themselves, the Villagers looking on, grievi over their loss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, Six says torch this place!   Blow the weapons in place. Round up  all suspected Vee Cees and shake it  up! We ain't got much light left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Wolfe) Why the fuck didn't you do something  Lieutenant!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about! (turns away, goes  about his business)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (spins him around) You know what I'm talking about!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No I don't. I don't know what the  fuck you're talking about, Elias! (goes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who wants to be reminded? A silence of shame. The Men mov away, Warren, Ace, Tony, Rodriguez, Barnes looking back o a cold glare. The Village Chief is a broken-looking man, huddled over h wife's body. Elias stands there, frustrated. Chris glances at him, moves out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A zippo cigarette lighter with the engraved initials: 'Fr Mai lin to my Bunny Boy'. It sparks a thick flare as Bunn lights the dry straw on the roof of the Hutch where he ki the Old Woman and Young Boy. Their legs sticking out at the threshold. The hooch burni fast, aided by the strong sun. Bunny watches with awe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sgt. Warren and Rodriguez lighting another hooch on fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fu Sheng yelling 'FIRE IN THE HOLE!' throws white phospho into the rice stores.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnes and Huffmeister, a big German kid from Texas, are  laying the cord to blow the weapons cache.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adams and Parker are poisoning the well with a white  phosphorus grenade: 'FIRE IN THE HOLE!'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wolfe, Ace, Tubbs, Warren, Rogriguez rope the DOZEN SUSPE VILLAGERS together to take them back for questioning. Elias watches the Villagers mourn their losses. In the  background, explosions, hooches popping with flames, the  yells of the violations of the Village winding down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris wanders through this wreckage in the sun, like a da visitor from another planet, not believing it. He sees  something, goes towards it - knows what it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hidden at the edge of the woodline, King hands back a bow of grass to Rhah, the chief head. They're puffing away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whew! - where that come from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Found it. Growing in a garden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smokes) Sheeit, beats burning hutches  anyway...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They meditatively look out at the Village - burning hutch sending up spirals of smoke. Shouts. Shots. Chaos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah - stoned's the way to be...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a ditch running alongside the Village, partially conce by foliage and anthills, Tony, Morehouse, and the ubiquit Bunny have a 12-YEAR-OLD VIETNAMESE GIRL pinned to the gr gagged and squirming, naked. They are fucking her to deat Junior looks on, both curious and disgusted, but doesn't  take part.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take her up the ass...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they roll her over, like excited dogs in heat. Chris, coming up, sees their heads dipping up and down on the other side of the anthill, knows what they're doing. makes a conscious decision to do something. He runs over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LET HER GO! YOU HEAR ME! YOU ASSHOLE!  LET HER GO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He strides right into them, shoves them off hard. The gir is in tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck you want - she's a  dink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO - YOU STUPID FUCK... DON'T...  DON'T... YOU TOO BUNNY. MOREHOUSE.  OFF! NO! DON'T... DON'T!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He seems disconnected, dazed by the sun, like he's talkin to dogs - loud, repetitive words coming out of an anger h can barely control, trying to restore some sanity to a wo gone totally nuts today. Don't they understand? Don't the have any sense of a mind? Any kind of decency? The Men looking at him as if he's the one who's gone nuts not them. Bunny looking at Morehouse looking at Tony look at Junior. The irony is lost on them, as Chris pushes thr to help the poor girl put her scanty clothes back on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the girl) It's okay... it's okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elias appears behind Bunny and the others, sees what's  happened. He signals them to move out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get outta here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men grumble and slink off quietly. Elias watching as. Chris helps her to her feet, wounded in the intestines, s can barely stand, blood soaking in her nether regions. Ch slings her up as gently as he can and carries her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as if to himself) It's okay, it's okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Near the pig pen, a DOZEN SUSPECTS are being led away on  ropes by Tubbs, Warren, Rodriguez. The others left behind look back at their village in ruins, homes burning, lives dead or scattered, belongings thrown and broken in the di BABIES wail, the adults squat there on their heels watchi with absolutely no trace of outward emotion. Past this Bosch-like canvas, Chris - carrying the girl -  walks dazed by the horrors of this long afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soldiers depart the village. A huge EXPLOSION now roc the earth and sends a spray of smoke into the blue sky as the weapons cache explodes in stages that sound like the of the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Company is digging into another overnight perimeter o ridge with a view of the Valley where the Village was. C- Ration fires all around the perimeter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the Company, Elias, Captain Harris, Barnes, Lt. Wolfe huddled. Close on Harris, looking from face to face, assu a judicial attitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and you Lieutenant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't see anything sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That dink was reported to me as NVA  sir by Sergeant Barnes. Sergeant  Barnes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Squirreling out of any responsibility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My report sir, will include Lt. Wolfe  as being witness to the shooting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, Elias. Sergeant Barnes, I  want a report from you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it sir - and I can throw in  plenty of eye-witnesses if you want  sir...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not now. We'll get into this when we  get back to base camp. Right now I  need every man in the field, I want  your guys to stick together... Elias?  Barnes?... You hear me? This is no  time for fighting with each other. (pause, they nod) Tomorrow we're going back into that  bunker complex - from the East. (continuing) First Platoon will lead... Brigade  thinks they might be back there  tomorrow. That's all... Get some  rest. (turns away)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnes, Elias eye each other and move off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wolfe walks alongside Barnes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about it Sergeant, he  won't be able to prove a thing, he's  a troublemaker but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnes is obviously worried, although he doesn't let on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elias' a waterwalker... like them  politicians in Washington. Want to  fight their war with one hand tied  round their balls. Ain't no time or  need for a courtroom out here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wolfe leaves him as Barnes turns into his foxhole where B and O'Neill await him anxiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd it go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banres shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thataway Sarge, fuckin' Elias man,  fuckin' squeal that's what he is,  gonna get everybody in the platoon  in shit. Somebody oughta fix his  ass...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnes fixing his coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (worried) Gonna be an investigation or something  Bob?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnes says nothing, a cryptic look. O'Neill worried, Bunny, taking his cue from Barnes, slaps him on the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya worry too much O'Neill...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elsewhere on the perimeter, Chris is digging out a foxhol with Rhah, as King and Lerner prepare the C's for dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know Barnes six months and I'll  tell ya something - that man is MEAN,  red in his soul like a dick on a  dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnes gets killed, his jaws'd go on  clacking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's he from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnes comes from Hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tennessee someplace. Hill country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnes took a bullet right there.   At Ia Drang Valley... (points to his forehead) And the cocksucker SURVIVED - that's  BAAAD man. That's his high, baby.  High on WAR!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes flare out dramatically. Chris, enthralled in spi of himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He done a year in Japan in the  hospital, then when he gets out, the  first thing he done is re-up. Four  years he been in the field...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and you know how many times he  done been shot? (Chris shakes his  head) Seven times! (with his fingers) Seven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he still wanted to come back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does a pee wee wanna take a wee wee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Good Lord works his revenge in  strange ways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you done said it. Revenge on  US.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does he have a metal plate in his  head?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) You mean he's crazy? No more crazy'n  the rest of us been out in the bush  too long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well he ain't normal that's fo sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what he is... Baaaa!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His hand flashes forward in front of Chris. 'HATE' is wri across the left hand knuckles in a sloppy, purplish-black tatoo. Chris looking at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and he's FILLED with it. He's  roaming these jungles looking for  little yellow devils to kill. Remember  the Devil does God's work too. (pause) ...and this here's Elias... Baaaa!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other knuckle is out - 'LOVE' tattooed across it. Rha smiles his crazy smile. Chris stares fascinated at the tw knuckles side by side. A moment on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love, yeah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
