dialogues.text: (makes a cuckoo sign) Here we go again with the crazy  preacher stuff. Rhah seen too many  movies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baaa, got no time to go to the movies.   Love and Hate too busy fighting for  possession of my soul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Elias come from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interjecting) 'Lias come naturally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...don't know. Done some time. Heard  he worked the oil wells in Oklahoma,  made some bread and washed up in El  Lay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, get married to some crazy El  Lay bitch, an actress or somethin',  she blew all his bread - LSD, gurus,  all that California shit, and then  she turns him into the cops on a  drug rap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not the only man to meet his Jezebel  either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So he got a reduced and come over  here. Nam's his freedom man, Nam's  his pussy. Three years he been here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three years, Jesus, he's crazy as  Barnes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well sometimes a man jes don' wanna  go back. How you gonna talk to  civilians man? People back in the  world just don't give a shit, y'know  what I mean, to them you're a fuckin'  animal is all -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Chris) I was home on leave y'know and  everybody's just worried 'bout making  money, everybody's out for themselves,  they don't even want to talk about  it man, it's like the fucking Twilight  Zone back there - you wouldn't even  KNOW there's a war on here. My sister  says to me why you have to go there  like I started this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baaaa! Fuck it, they sold us out -  so what! What'd you'all expect?   Civilian life is phoney BULLSHIT  man. They're ROBOTS man - watchin'  dopey television and drivin' dopey  cars, and they fuck up, nobody dies.   That's all right, you keep fuckin'  up, politicians keep lyin'. Cause it  don't really matter. Don't mean shit.  So what! Whatcha want - a parade!  Fuck that too! No war time no grunt  never got no respect. Till he was  dead - and even THEN! You're fighting  for YOURSELF man! You're fighting  for your SOUL, dat's all. Remember  dat. And it's some goddamn battle  too - if you'se a man, wrestle with  that angel... (swings his entrenching  tool in a rhythmic  chain-gang style) ...Love and Hate - the whole shitbang  show, that's the story then and now  and it ain't hardly gonna change...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stars are out in magnificent splendor. A breeze rustl through the trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris is turning in his sleep, perturbed, writhing. The  whispering is more and more urgent. Death is all around. shoots up out of his poncho liner as if shot, stunned.   Scared. Looks around. All is quiet. Men sleeping. Elias is huddled in his poncho on guard next to his foxho Chris joins him, sitting, wiping the sleep from his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I can't sleep, why don't you get  some sack time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...don't feel like it either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...beautiful night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I love this place at night.   The stars... there's no right or  wrong in them, they're just there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a nice way of putting it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elias cuffs a joint, keeping its glow hidden in the dark. pause, both of them meditative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnes got it in for you, don't he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (philosophically) Barnes believes in what he's doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you, do you believe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In '65 - yeah. Now... (pause) No. What happened today's just the  beginning. We're gonna lose this  war...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised) You really think so... us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elias' eyes seem to go to some inner place, his passion  surging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...we been kicking other people's  asses so long I guess it's time we  got our own kicked. The only decent  thing I can see coming out of here  are the survivors - hundreds of  thousands of guys like you Taylor  going back to every little town in  the country knowing something about  what it's like to take a life and  what that can do to a person's soul -  twist it like Barnes and Bunny and  make 'em sick inside and if you got  any brains you gonna fight it the  rest of your life cause it's cheap,  killing is cheap, the cheapest thing  I know and when some drunk like  O'Neill starts glorifying it, you're  gonna puke all over him and when the  politicians start selling you a used  war all over again, you and your  generation gonna say go fuck yourself  'cause you know, you've seen it, and  when you know it, deep down there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He plants his fist in Chris' gut, expelling his breath su is the force of the blow - like a power passed between th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...you know it till you die... that's  why the survivors remember. 'Cause  the dead don't let em forget.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes blazing, reliving the deaths in the village, lic the wounds for the platoon, mourning the failure of its  heroism. Chris looking at him, a little awed by his inten Elias looks away, embarrassed that he has sermonized, loo back at the stars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit! Sometimes there's things in  my head... man. Grass does that to  me, fucks me all up like a crazy  Indian...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you believe that stuff about...  knowing you're gonna die?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, those are the guys that live.  I really don't think Death gives a  shit, it's like a giant garbage can,  I think it takes whatever it can  get... you never know where it's  gonna come from anyway... so why  spin your wheels?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shrugs, a certain bravado masking his own uncertainty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...You ever think about reincarnation,  all that stuff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lightning quick movement follows. Elias' hand passing o his face like a mime, a click of the fingers and he leans closer to Chris. A new expression on his face. Devil's ey mocking child, danger in his soul, excitement, sex - the  Elias that Chris saw in the smoking session in base camp. Chris smiles, sucked in, almost laughs and then the face gone again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, goes on all the time. Maybe a  piece of me's in you now, who knows.  But when you die - really die - that's  a big return ticket. (soft) I like to think I'm gonna come back  as... as wind or fire - or a deer (likes the image) ...yeah, a deer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles at the thought. Chris looks at him, looks away. shooting star falls suddenly and dryly through the cosmos Their eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Platoon moves along a shallow STREAM bordering the ju A thick RAIN falls amid cracks of distant thunder. Chris, Rhah, Francis, Big Harold, others are at the rear of the  platoon, their ponchos pulled over them like big sad grey tents. There's a holdup ahead and the Men rest on rocks o stand. The rain makes a pointilistic pattern, the men col of grey, their rifles slung upside down to keep dry. Barnes is up ahead, out of the stream bank, on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lerner's on point, resting in the shadow of a decaying ol French Catholic Church from the 19th Century. The jungle long ago won the battle, vines creeping into the cracks,  remnants of arches layered around the church at the epice Behind Lerner is Sgt. Warren and his radioman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elias, further back, is checking out the jungle alongside the clearing, noticing a number of old spider holes long  since abandoned. He goes over and checks them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back at the stream, Rhah, looking old and whiskered under his poncho hood, lights up a roach, puffs it. Another cra of thunder. Chris comes over, sits with him on his rock. Rhah passes him the joint. He smokes. Big Harold pulls a leech out of his open crotch area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, lookit this little fucker trying  to get up ma glory hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Big Harold, put dat in your turkey  loaf it won't come out your back  end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ribbing) Yeah, big boy, thought you had that  laundry gig all laid out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pissed) Shit, got to paint myself white get  one of dem jobs. Get ma request in  for a circumcision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gonna be a rabbi man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gonna cut your pecker down to size  hunh Big Harold?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dat's okay wid me, better to have a  small one den no one at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your girlfriends gonna look for new  lovers, man. Best thing a bro's got's  his flap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll drink to your flap in Chicago,  King. All I gotta do is stretch it  out to 15 days and I'll be short 15  and the Beast just wouldn't dare  send me back to the bush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna get some for me back in  the World, Harold? Whatcha gonna do? (dreaming of it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The world's gonna be ma oyster man.  First's I gonna EAT - all the  hamburger and french fries and steaks  soaked in onions and ketchup I can  get. Then I'se gonna FUCK and SUCK  Sandy Bell till I sore all over and  can't fuck no more, and den I'se  gonna SLEEP for DAYS, for WEEKS!   Den I'se gonna think bout what comes  next...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The words carry over Chris staring out at the rain, feeli a leaden fatigued high. Passes the roach, down to a  millimeter, back to Rhah who points to his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...you got one right there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris feels for, finds the leech on the edge of his lip,  cursing under his breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in the stream, on  radio) All right move out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men start slogging on against the rain. Junior is drinking from the stream, as Fu Sheng passes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't drink that asshole. You're  gonna get malaria.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit I hope so!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On point, Lerner moves out through a remnant of an old ar somewhat casual in his approach to point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Sarge, you wanna tell me which  way or do I get to figger it out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sgt. Warren, picking up a quick azimuth on his lensatic  compass, points. Lerner moves in the new direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lerner moves away from the clearing, working up a slight  incline when the MACHINE GUN FIRE erupts out of the jungl spinning him - throwing him into the dirt like discarded  garbage. The men are down, yelling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ambush! Incoming! Fucking incoming!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly an RPG rocket breaks out of the bush, sounding l an atom bomb as it devastates the front of the Platoon. R Talk is continuous now, back and forth between the three  platoon radios, through the ambush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOC, UP HERE! Lerner's hit!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More machine gun fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOC! Over here - we got... one...  two down. Warren's hit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris moving up with Rhah and the others out of the strea they hit the ground next to Sgt. O'Neill, who looks prett scared, obviously not about to move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit they got RPG's on our ass.  Fucking ambush - they was waiting  for us to break trail!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WATCH OUT! ROCKET!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another rocket whistling in. A huge roar. Trees shredded, dirt, dust rising.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's on point?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lerner and Warren.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris uses his M-16 to lever himself up into a crouch and suddenly dashes forward, passing Rhah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you goin' man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris tearing up. Past Flash - the hip black head with th colored beads. He's dead, torn and shredded, his face and eyes stuff with dirt. Next to him Doc is frantically  tourniqueting Tubbs, shot in the legs. He's screaming. Chris keeps moving to the front as if compelled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnes is laying out fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamit, you assholes get fucking'  firepower out there! (to Hoyt on radio) Get Two Bravo up here. Get me a gun. (to others) Spread it out! More to the flanks!  Look for a fuckin' target!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another explosion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris comes alongside Francis near the point, throws hims down. Banging his head against his helmet as he falls. Th incoming rounds are tearing up the front of the platoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Francis) Where's Lerner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (terrified) Out there man - behind the log.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking. A body - moaning, sort of moving, wriggling, as trying to escape the pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes moving to Sgt. Warren lying alongside a tree - c trying to stack his intestines back into his ruptured sto Another RPG comes in. Chris makes a conscious decision, moves up - bit by bit,  shielding himself with tree stumps, ant hills, laying out fire, trying to get closer to Lerner. Francis following his progress, bug-eyed. Fu Sheng now comes up with his M-60 - Harold his loader,  belts of ammo flapping against their bodies. He fires fro the hip, providing cover fire for Chris, then pops down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris, firing out another magazine, crawls closer to Lern trying to ascertain if he's still alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lerner! Lerner, can you hear me man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lerner groans. A fresh burst of AK fire rakes the area.   Lerner jerks spasmodically with the impact of the rounds. Chris spots the sniper. In a hole in the ground. Twenty-f meters off. Snapping the magazine out of his AK to reload A live gook. Chris tears off a volley at him but the gook disappears i the hole. This is the moment, Chris realizes it, it's now never if Chris intends to get the gook. He's got to make move before the man has reloaded his weapon. He pulls his grenade, pops the pin. He lets the spoon fly off, activating the grenade-timer, as he humps to his fee and runs for the gook hole, concentrating, concentrating. That head is going to pop up any second with a freshly-lo weapon and tear his head off. Chris won't make it back to the hole. The throw has to be perfect. He won't get another chance. He heaves the frag, drops and rolls away. The throw is perfect, the golden ar of flight from the outfield nailing the baserunner. It tw cleanly in the hole. The explosion muffled but deadly. Chris scrambles to his feet, a look of almost total surpr on his face. He can't seem to believe he did it. Pointing his M-16 before him, he advances on the hole, looking ove the muzzle to see the badly-mangled NVA man twisted at th bottom. Chris hurries over to Lerner. He's in bad shape, hit in  several places, vaguely conscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gator! Gator! (Lerner groans) I'm gonna get you out man. You're  gonna be okay Gator... okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fu Sheng laying out fire to protect them, Harold splittin off to get more ammo. Chris getting Lerner to his feet, hauling him back with a his strength, past Francis...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lt. Wolfe seems disorientated, struggling with the rain w washing off his map, trying to read the coordinates for a arty fire mission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the radio) Redleg, Redleg... Ripper Bravo Two  Actual. Fire mission. Grid six-four- niner... four-zero-two. Direction  six-one-zero-zero. Dinks dug in  bunkers. Danger close. Adjust fire,  over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rog, Two Bravo. Solid copy, stand by  for shot, out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, Bravo Three is inbound from the  Sierra Whiskey. Should be here in  two zero mikes if'n they don' hit  any shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckin' A!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elias runs up to him. Fire all around, incoming and outgo makes them yell to each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lootenant, they're kickin our ass,  they know we're gonna bring heavy  shit on 'em pretty soon so they're  gonna get in tight under the arty. I  spotted a cut running around to the  left. Lemme take some men and roll  up that flank... (pointing) I can work right up on 'em...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wolfe unsure, looks up for the artillery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ace) Get me Barnes... I don't know 'Lias,  we got four down up there, if I split  you off, we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elias grabs a stick, urgent, starts drawing their positio in the dirt for Wolfe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Lootenant...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wolfe looks up, relieved as Barnes splashes into the CP g Thunder peals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling at Wolfe and  Ace) Where the fuck is red platoon! Tell  'em to get their asses up here! What  the fuck you doin' back here Elias?   Round up your assholes and move 'em  up front, we're getting chopped to  shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling back) Barnes, listen to me... there's 5-6  spiderholes back there (points) next to the church. (draws it into the  ground as he talks) Third Platoon's coming up the stream  to reinforce us. Flank's wide open,  dinks get 3-4 snipers in these holes,  when Third Platoon comes up, they'll  get us in a crossfire with 'em. We'll  shoot each other to shit, then they'll  hit us with everything they got.   It'll be a massacre!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnes looking at the drawing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds pretty far out to me 'Lias.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe but I seen it happen at Ia  Drang in '66, First Cavalry and they  cut us to fuckin' pieces! (back to Barnes) Give me three men, if I'm wrong, I  can still roll up that flank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a look) Take off, but keep your radio here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elias goes, stops, looks at Barnes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...You keep pouring out that  suppressing fire, Barnes. I don't  wanna be caught out there with my  ass hanging out you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me how to fight this  fucking war, 'Lias, you go crying to  fucking brigade on your time. Out  here you belong to me. Now move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A look. Elias goes fast. More thunder peals. As the 155mm howitzers - sounding like deep tom-toms some three miles  distant - beat out their shells. An ominous sound. Closer

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir! Shot out. Arty's on the way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hurrying back to the  front) Get that asshole O'Neill up here  willya!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fu Sheng is laying out fire when he senses something, loo up. The artillery shell sounds too close. Getting bigger bigger on the horizon. Too big, too loud. A groan of fear his face, then knowledge. Then... a huge EXPLOSION engulf him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Short round! It's short, man! They  fuckin' got Fu Sheng! BARNES! OVER  HERE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnes hearing it, starts forward. Another huge shell sta to whistle in on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That fuckin' idiot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It explodes. This is about three times the intensity of t RPG. The jungle floor shakes, trees splinter. Barnes is  knocked to his knees, grimaces in pain. Hoyt, Barnes' rad operator, screams out as a fist-sized chunk of hot shrapn sticks in his back. He's screeching, frantically trying t shuck the radio from his back, his fatigue shirt smoking. Barnes jerks the radio off Hoyt's back, knocks the man to his knees and unsheathes his bayonet. Ripping off the bac of his shirt, Barnes sets to digging out the shrapnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morehouse is decimated by a third explosion, chunks of  shrapnel whirring like battleaxes into the tree trunks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Harold is tearing blindly away from the front, helmet gone, rifle dragging in the mud when he stumbles, sprawli face down. He jumps up, looks back, sees now the wire ove which he tripped. It takes a second to register. He share look with Bunny who's already on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Satchel charge! GET DOWN!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold goes for the ground the same instant the satchel  explodes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris, further back, dumps Lerner with Doc who's got more than he can handle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take care of him Doc! Please!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc looking at him, a dark look of hopelessness. Lerner i mess, groaning, reaching for Chris' hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...don't... don't leave me man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A look between them. Rhah interjecting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taylor - get your ass over here.   Move!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang tough, Gator. Hang in there,  man, you're gonna be OK... just hang  on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feeling like a liar, peeling the man's hands off him, lea him there looking numb. Chris is shaken, Lerner's blood a over him. He tears out after Rhah, linking up with Elias and Crawfo Elias motioning them to hurry. Another huge artillery rou exploding out to the front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sgt. O'Neill, scared out of his mind, hugging the earth,  tries to crawl into a small cut in the ground but finds i occupied by a cringing Junior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnes rushes up out of the forest like Achilles, towerin in his rage, at Lieutenant Wolfe, ripping his handset fro him as the Lieutenant reads off the coordinates off his m

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOU IGNORANT ASSHOLE! - What the  fuck coordinates you giving! You  killed a bunch of people with that  fucked up fire mission! You know  that?... ah shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wolfe stares at him, open-mouthed. Disgusted, Barnes hunk down to read the coordinates from his own map into the  handset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Redleg Romeo.. Ripper Bravo Two.  Check your fire, check fire, you're  short on our pos! I say again, check  your fuckin' fire!... From  Registration point, add one five  zero, left five zero, fire for effect!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New incoming fire drowns out Barnes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elias - a defiant look on his face - moves fast but cauti back across the Church landmarks. Chris following then Rh and Crawford. The RAIN has now settled into a mist huggin the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move it! Move it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elias comes to a stop, looks. Behind them we hear the sou of battle, gauging their distance from the main body. The spider holes are still empty. But he listens, senses  something out there getting closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're coming...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris looking at Rhah. How does he know? Elias points out an imaginary line across the breaking mi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stagger yourselves across this line,  shoot anything that moves. They'll  be coming from here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (team leader) Gotcha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of them gets through it's  curtains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down along the river 'bout 100 metres,  'case they try to flank us there.  Third Platoon's coming up on our  rear so watch for 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... I move faster alone. (a grin)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elias, his pack stripped, is gone, like a fleet leaf,  vanishing into the Jungle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stringing them out) Okay Crawford - over here. Taylor -  down twenty yards behind that tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnes has finished correcting the fire mission, hurls th handset back at Wolfe, a wild look in his eyes, studying incoming fire. Makes a decision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's move back, link up with Three.   Let the arty do a little work. (to Ace on radio,  ignoring Wolfe) Push Two Alpha and Two Charlie.  Tell'em to haul ass and re-group at  the church. Tell'em NOT to fire. (Ace transmits)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Elias? We pull back they'll  be cut off. He needs cover fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at him like  he's stupid) I'll get him. (with a threatening  undertone) You just haul ass too lootenant. (going, to Ace) ...don't send Bravo Three up till I  get back to the CP. Now move out,  all of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he snaps his weapon onto full auto and runs off after  Elias in a crouch... a man with a mission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next to the Church deployed in the jungle, Rhah looks on, silent. Chris in his position, waits. It is so silent in comparis to the racket from the battle across the forest. The Mist clings to the trees, moist and lovely. Then, a flicker of movement, sound. Chris hears it, tightens. His POV - at fifty yards. An  evanescence of beige and green uniforms moving towards hi very fast, scurrying. They look like headless ghosts. Chris opens fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GET EM!!!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhah and Crawford open up. A rachet of sound, one of the  figures seems to go down, then another but at this distan through jungle it is difficult to say. The firing just as suddenly breaks off and the silence returns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ecstatic) Yeah! I got two of them fuckers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got one...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...See them go down? Like fuckin'  target practice man, fuck you  Charlie!! Ho Chi Minh sucks dead  dick!... Crawford! (sees him, stunned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crawford, the blond-locked California beach boy, lies on earth, hit in a lung, having difficulty breathing, moanin in a soft undercurrent. Chris runs up on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh man!... man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attending him. Rhah runs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like a lung babe. But you're  gonna be all right, you only need  one of them fuckers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit man I never thought I'd get  hit, I was... (gagging)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay cool. We gonna carry you out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnes appears, running towards them, looking down at  Crawford, at Rhah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarge, 'bout five gooks tried to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Elias?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...came through right over there. We  got three of them, we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't you hear the arty shift? We're  pulling back. Get your wounded man  and get the fuck back to the church.  Get going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating jungle) ...but 'Lias is still out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get him. You get the man in,  Taylor (indicating Crawford) NOW. Or I'll Article 15 both your  asses. Move!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris and Rhah look at Barnes sullenly, then reluctantly  start moving Crawford onto a poncho liner they use as a  litter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move it, MOVE IT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in his blackest rage, the force of his words almost  physically pushing the men to move out with Crawford. Bar turns now to deal with Elias.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elsewhere, Elias stands silently, listens to the forest. the distance the firefight can hardly be heard. His helme gone, his hair hanging free, he is at his best now - alon He hears it. Somebody running through the jungle, about 1 yards, boots on leaves, coming towards him. He begins to move lateral to the sound. His steps unheard better at this than the enemy. THREE ENEMY FIGURES now appear, crouched and moving very  fast with light equipment through the mist. Elias swerves up in immediate foreground, his back to us, FIRING. All three Figures fall. A quick glimpse of Elias, not bothering to stop, moving t his next position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnes, moving through the jungle, reacts to the fire,  resetting his course. Like a hunter stalking a deer. Sudd there's more firing. Then silence -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO MORE ENEMY lie dead in the jungle. A rustle of moveme then a CRY - chilling, jubilant, a war cry. A pair of feet moving lightly over the jungle. A glimpse Elias. In his full glory. Roaming the jungle, born to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnes fixing on him, moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An NVA SOLDIER, jungle-whiskered, dirty, smart, crouches, listens, looks to his PARTNER. What are they fighting her The First One mutters something sharp and they split fast the direction they've come. They get about six steps when Elias suddenly rises up fro the bush, not ten yards in front of them, his shots rippi into them, driving the surprised life from them. Elias is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elsewhere, another three NVA stop, turn and flee back fro where they came.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris and Rhah get Crawford back to the church grounds, l him down. No activity around them. Chris plunges back int the jungle where they left Barnes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taylor!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnes moving, stops, listens. Something is running towar him. But it's hidden by the bush. He brings his rifle up  smooth and quick, waits, then as the bush parts, Elias is standing there. Looking at Barnes. Barnes sees him, starts to lower his rifle, but then stop He raises it back an inch, sights it. Pause. A cold seari look of hatred coming over his face. In that moment, Elias understands. Quick as a deer, he ma his move, trying to plunge back into the bush. Barnes fires. Once, twice, three times - the blast rockin the jungle. Elias jerking backwards into the bush, mortally wounded. Bird cries. A crime against nature. Barnes calmly lowers his rifle, and walks away from it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris, cutting through the jungle, hears the shots. He st listens. Someone is moving through bush towards him, leav and foliage shaking. Chris tightens, raises his rifle. Barnes steps through into his sight - sees him. Chris lowers his rifle. Barnes walking past him as if he  weren't even there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elias is dead. Join up with the  platoon. Move it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shocked) He's dead! Where?... You saw him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Back about 100 metres. He's  dead, now get going, the gooks are  all over the fuckin' place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moving on quickly. Chris has no choice but to follow, loo back one more time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO CHOPPERS are coming into a LZ in front of the Church. The two platoons, Second and Third, reinforcing, are bein evacuated as quickly as possible, one load (6-8 men, depe on the wounded) after other. The choppers are spraying du all over the place. A scene of chaos, radio talk layering it. Doc is out of supplies, making do with improvised  bandages, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOVE IT MOVE IT MOVE IT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lerner goes by, horribly wounded on a makeshift litter, i the chopper, Doc attending, holding the IV. Chris catching a glimpse of him, waiting to get on the  chopper, turning to look as: Hoyt and Sgt. Warren, both wounded, are hurried aboard on litters. The chopper lifting off. Chris and others now running to the corpses of Flash,  Morehouse, and Fu Sheng lying under dirty ponchos, their  boots sticking out. The ponchos are blown away in a burst wind off the chopper blades, revealing their faces - dirt stuffing their eyes and mouths, waxen figures. Chris and the others lifting them and carrying them towar the next chopper now coming in. They throw the bodies on. Tubbs and Crawford, both wounde now move past Chris, into the chopper. Chris running back with King carrying a litter - their eyes falling on: Barnes talking with Wolfe and Ace, making signals under t roaring sounds of the chopper. Shaking his head. No. No E Chris and King looking at each other, mute. They numbly s loading Big Harold, minus his leg, onto the stretcher. The Third Chopper is down now, waiting, roaring blades  silhouetting off the face of the cathedral. A ROCKET BLAS suddenly goes off not too far from the chopper, incoming  fire. The DOOR GUNNER signaling for them to hurry, laying out fire.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. CHOPPER
dialogues.text: Chris and King hustling Big Harold's 250 pounds into the  chopper. Climbing in with him. Wolfe, Barnes, Ace running with them. The perimeter is bare. Chris' eyes flitting over Barnes as he jumps in. The chop lifting off as another explosion rocks the area. The Door Gunner sees something, opens up. Big Harold, cursing, looks chalky but hog happy as he man a glance down at the jungle. His right leg is gone. Tears are rolling out of his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, you gonna be in Japan this time  tomorrow, Big Harold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'se lucky dis time, what's a  leg to get the fuck outta here ... (at the NVA) Eat ma shit, you motherfuckers!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sinks back, sick. Chris' eyes suddenly fix on somethin He can't believe it. He shoves King, points. King sees it Both stunned. Barnes is looking. So's Lt. Wolfe, so's Ace. So's the Doo Gunner. Elias is coming out of the jungle. Staggering, blood  disfiguring his face and chest, hanging on with all his  dimming strength, looking up at them - trying to reach th Chris shakes Wolfe, his words drowned out by the roar. The Chopper Captain looking down, dips. His co-pilot poin The NVA are coming out of the jungle, closing on the spot where Elias is. Incoming rounds are hitting the chopper. The Door Gunner  maniacally firing. Barnes looking down at the man, can't believe it. Elias is on his last legs now, obviously being hit by the incoming fire of the NVA. He falls to his knees, still  stretching upwards for life. The Chopper Captain shakes his head at Wolfe. The Chopper dips one more time firing at the NVA, low and fierce over the jungle. Chris looking back in horror. Elias crucified. The NVA coming out now by the dozens fro the treeline. Elias crumbling to the ground. Obviously dead or dying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...we still got one on the deck.  Bring the gunships in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnes drawing in. Chris looking at him in revulsion. He knows. Barnes sees look, ignores it, all of them sitting there silent, livin with that final horrifying image of Elias.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The 'heads' are assembled - what's left of them. Rhah, Ki Francis, Doc, Adam, a quiet black kid, and Chris, who is  impassioned tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He killed him. I know he did. I saw  his eyes when he came back in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (puffing on his bowl) How do you know the dinks didn't get  him. You got no proof man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Proof's in the eyes. When you know  you know. You were there Rhah - I  know what you were thinking. I say  we frag the fucker. Tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks to King who puffs on a joint, his eyes red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I go with dat, an eye for an eye  man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right on, nothing wrong with Barnes  another shot in the head wouldn't  cure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Chris) Shit boy you been out in the sun too  long. You try that, he'll stick it  right back up your ass with a candle  on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what do you suggest big shot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Chris) I suggest you watch your own asses  cause Barnes gonna be down on ALL OF  'EM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you figger that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit man - Human nature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flashes the old knuckle - 'HATE'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you jes gonna forget 'bout Elias  and all the good times we done had?   Right in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He dugged his own grave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (correcting) He dug it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He DUGGED it too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck this shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys trying to cure the headache  by cutting off the head. 'Lias didn't  ask you to fight his battles and if  there's a Heaven - and god, I hope  so - I know he's sitting up there  drunk as a fuckin' monkey and smokin'  shit cause HIS PAINS HE DONE LEFT  DOWN HERE. Baaaaaaaaa! (a vehement movement  of his head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're wrong man! Any way you cut it  Rhah, Barnes is a murderer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember first time you came in  here Taylor you telling me how much  you admired that bastard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snorts) Wrong? You ain't EVER been right -  'bout nothing. And dig this you  assholes and dig it good! Barnes  been shot 7 times and he ain't dead,  that tell you something? Barnes ain't  meant to die. Only thing can get  Barnes... is Barnes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnes stands there, silhouetted in the trap door, lookin down at the men who are stunned to see him here. He steps down into the hutch, his face now lit by candle  light. A bottle of whiskey in his hand, drunk, ugly, swea but as always, with dignity, possessive of his silence. H feels their fear in the silence, enjoys it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (soft) Talking 'bout killing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He totters slightly as he circles the outer edge of the h No one talks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'all experts? Y'all know about  killing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes the bowl from Adams, smokes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You pussies gotta smoke this shit  so's you can hide from reality?... (smokes again) Me I don't need that shit. I AM  reality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Confronting Chris, he moves on, taunting them all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's the way it oughta be and  there's the way it is. 'Lias he was  full of shit, 'Lias was a crusader -  I got no fight with a man does what  he's told but when he don't, the  machine breaks down, and when the  machine breaks down, WE break down...  and I ain't gonna allow that. From  none of you. Not one...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walks past Rhah, past King, throws the pot bowl into the  dirt of the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'all loved Elias, want to kick ass,  I'se here - all by my lonesome, nobody  gonna know. Five you boys 'gainst  me? (pause, very soft) Kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost an appeal - naked, intense. Rhah, Francis, Doc loo away. King, the biggest one there, is about to say something, b the moment passes. Chris waits, his anger on the rise. Barnes takes a swigger from the whiskey, then turns away  contemptuously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I SHIT on all o' you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KILL YOU MOTHERFUCKER!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris slams into Barnes, rushing him off his feet. Poundi his face, solid blows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get that mother, babe, go... Kick  his ass, kill that cocksucker!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Barnes is too quick and very strong and takes the blo getting outside Chris' arm, twisting and flipping him in wrestler's grip - throwing him hard onto his back on the  dirt floor. The expression of the Men watching slumps, their hopes da Barnes springs around on Chris, straddles him, one hand  pushing his face back, hits him hard. Once. Twice. Chris grimaces, groans, helpless now. A flick of sound. A knife whipped out of Barnes' boot and pressing against  Chris' throat. Chris bleeding from the nose and mouth. Rhah suddenly spinning into action, fast now, realizing w Barnes intends to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EASY BARNES, EASY MAN!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnes is on the verge - about to kill again. Chris waiting. Rhah coaxing him, moving closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll do dinky dau in Long Binh  Barnes. Ten years - kill an enlisted.  Ten years, Barnes, just climb the  walls. DON'T DO IT...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnes' eyes tremble in the candle light, his scars ugly, spasm clenching and locking his facial muscles. Then sudd he is calm again, very calm. We sense a man of enormous s control. Suddenly he flicks his knife across Chris, leaving a mark below his left eye. Chris gasps. Looking up at Barnes rising off him. The boo alongside his face. The Men looking on, the tension lowering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (contemptuous) Death? What do you guys know about  it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks out. Quietly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris sits at the very edge of a Huey Chopper, bandana ar his forehead, long hair blowing in the wind, Barnes' mark below his eyes, slicked out now like a jungle veteran, lo down at the VILLAGE where the massacre occurred. The Village is still a smoking ruin, a few peasants and w buffalo straggling like ants to reconstruct. Bunny, next to Chris, pops his gum, indifferent. Barnes,  next to him, shifts, reads a map. Rodriguez is praying, his mouth moving without audible wo getting ready for the drop. King is making last minute adjustments in his pack. Bunny now nudges Chris, points. The Church in the Jungle  where Elias was killed is visible. An outline of the Ceme Uncomfortable memories play over Chris' face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sent us back into the valley  the next day - about 2,000 metres  from Cambodia - into a battalion  perimeter. Alpha Company had been  hit hard the day before by a sizeable  force and Charlie Company had been  probed that night. There were other  battalions in the valley, we weren't  the only ones but we knew we were  going to be the bait to lure them  out. And somewhere out there was the  entire 141st NVA Regiment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BATTALION PERIMETER now breaks in the clear ahead. Sm grenades of various colors are being popped on the cleare LZ. It's not big, its radius 200 yards, heavily sandbagge deeply dug, rolls of barbed wire protecting it, radio ant sprouting from the CP - and surrounded on all four sides jungle. The First Chopper rocking down, whipping up dust clouds. Chris jumps out, moving out fast as the Second Chopper st in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the Battalion CP, the Major confers with Captain Harri and two other Captains. Two NVA PRISONERS are sitting on  their knees, interrogated by Vietnamese Kit Carson scouts and a U.S. Sergeant, their hands tied. The Scout slaps the shit out of the NVA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All this is watched from a distance by Ace and Doc and Lt Wolfe at the Platoon CP. Ace and Doc are digging the foxh the ace of spades in Ace's helmet band, sharing the  information with Tony and Francis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...they caught 'em last night pulling  some shit on Charlie Company. They  found maps on 'em, man - got a friend  at Battalion says they had every  fuckin' foxhole here fixed on it.  Distances, treelines, our claymores,  trip wires, everything? I shit you  not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, so what the fuck are we doing  here? Why don't we move... (no answer) Bad vibes, man, I got bad vibes here.  Where are the new guys they provided  us anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard we's in Cambodia right fuckin'  NOW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You kidding man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhah comes up, a walking stick in hand, huge pirate kerch on his head, semi-naked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanted to see me sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackson, looks like you got Elias'  squad now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Squad? I didn't know we was still  referring to this platoon in terms  of squads sir. (with a snicker for  Ace and Doc)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating a rough  drawing in the dirt) These two holes are yours...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Begging your pardon Lieutenant but  my holes are far enuff apart you  could run a regiment through there  and nobody'd see them - I got five  live bodies left...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to hear your problems,  Jackson. You'll get new men any day.  Time being you make do like everybody  else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Lieutenant I didn't ask for this  job, I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leaves) I don't want to hear about it Jackson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amazed, looking off  at him) You don't want to hear about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns) That's right. I don't want to hear  about it 'cause to tell you the truth,  I don't give a shit okay... I just  don't give a shit anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs, to himself) Right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (passing Ace digging  the CP hole) This is one time we could sure use  Elias.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Doc) 'Some people say I'm wishy washy.  Maybe I am. Maybe I ain't.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the edge of the perimeter, King puts out his claymore, unraveling it back towards his FOXHOLE, intersecting MEN  form the Third Platoon, who file out on a night ambush,  skirting the trip wires, demoralized, silent. Eye exchang but no words. Chris sits on the foxhole watching the ambush go out, smo a joint by himself, depressed. King comes in with the cla wires, attaching them to their detonators. Their foxhole as are all of the Platoon's - is positioned just inside t treeline bordering the LZ, so that they are quite isolate from the center of the perimeter where they first landed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glad I ain't going with 'em. Somewhere  out dere man is de Beast and he hungry  tonight... Man, what a bummer. Ten  days and a wakeup and I'm still  dealing wid this shit - fuckin'  etcetera and ad infinitum man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LAST SOLDIER in the file recedes into the foliage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (noticing Chris'  silence) What's the matter wid you?... How  come you ain't writing no more? You  was always writing something home.   Looks like youse half a bubble off,  Taylor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't answer, makes a futile gesture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about your folks? That grandma  you was telling me about?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris' eyes answer negatively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must be somebody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...there's nobody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shifts, uncomfortable) You been smoking too much shit babe.  Gotta control that. Takes a man  down... I remember when you first  come out to the bush, you was straight  as a...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who gives a shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shifts, annoyed, prepares his grenades along the sand  bags. King shrugs, preparing his meal, sings himself a sn of song, a good natured man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (soft) 'People say I'm the life of the party  cause I tell a joke or two although  I may be laughing loud and hardy  deep inside I'm blue...'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'ever get caught in a mistake King  and you just can't get out of it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Way out of anything, man. Just keep  your pecker up, your powder dry, the  worm WILL turn. How many days you  short?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not just me... it's the way the whole  thing works. People like Elias get  wasted and people like Barnes just  go on making up rules any way they  want and what do we do, we just sit  around in the middle and suck on it!  We just don't add up to dry shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does a chicken have lips? Whoever  said we did, babe. Make it outta  here, it's all gravy, every day of  the rest of your life man - gravy.   Oh shit, superlifer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Neill comes up, jerks his thumb at King.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your gear together, King, your  orders just come through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (speechless) You jokin' me man?... shit, you ain't  kidding! Cocksucker. Oh wowww... the  lifers made a mistake, they cuttin'  me some slack, they cutting me some  slack Taylor! (dances)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collect your shit and move out King.  You got 10 minutes make the last  chopper. Cee ess em oh or your ass  is mine. (to Taylor) Francis is coming over. (hurries off)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: King packing up, double time. Chris comes over, helps him trying to share his happiness but not succeeding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey that's great King, that's great...  you take it on home for me, you tell  'em King... got your address right?   You know where you can reach men,  man. Anytime!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta didi man. Don't wanna miss  that chopper. I'll send you a  postcard. After I get me some. I'll  send you some tapes too man. This  new guy Jimi Hendrix man, whew...  you okay Taylor? Just 'member take  it easy now, don't think too much,  don't be a fool, no such thing as a  coward cause it don't mean nuthin.  Jes keep on keepin' on. Okay my man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris, fighting his depression, slaps hands with King. A  brief moment, they look at each other. A friendship that forever and is now over. They both sort of know they'll n see each other again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll walk you out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Francis coming up, hauling his pack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On another foxhole, Rodriguez positions his M-60, brings his ammo belts (no loaders left). Tony eating, nervous,  watches him, shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rumor goin' round is they got tanks.  Soviet shit, T-34's... (pause) Hey Rodriguez, don't you ever say  nothing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a thick Mexican accent) What do you want me to say, it's all  the same ol' shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony shrugs, back to his food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On another foxhole, Barnes in full pack checks the soles Junior's bare feet. Bunny and O'Neill looking on. Junior moaning as if he's dying, overdoing it by a mile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's the problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Says he can't walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. Get your boots on Martin, next  time I catch you putting mosquito  repellent on your fuckin' feet I'm  gonna courtmartial your nigger ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cracks) DEN COURTMARTIAL ME MOTHERFUCKAH,  bust my ass, send me to fucking Long  Binh, do your worst but I ain't  walking no more. De white man done  got his last klik outta me. Get some  chuck dude to hump this shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly soft) Get me that centipede, O'Neill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Neill is puzzled. What centipede?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarge?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah that long hairy orange and black  bastard I found in the ammo crate.  I'm gonna put it in this asshole's  crotch, see if he can walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junior's eyes bulge with suspicion and sudden terror, his demeanor totally alert now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (understanding) Oh yeah, right away Sarge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Wait! I'll walk, fuck you I'll  walk, I don't need this shit! I don't  need this shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking pussy, fuck it Sarge, I gotta  have him on my hole?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnes going. O'Neill catching up with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... Bob. Like to speak to you.  Take a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stops) Yeah, what is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shuffles, reluctant) Bob, I got Elias' R&R... It's coming  up in 3 days. Going to Hawaii. See  Patsy. (pause, no reaction  from Barnes) I never asked you for a break, I was  hoping you... you'd send me in on  the chopper with King... what do you  say Chief? (a friendly punch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do that for you, Red... We  need every swinging dick in the field.   Sorry bout that... (starts to go)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pleads) Hey Bob, come on! Talk to me hunh,  it's your friend Red, I'm only asking  you for three days chief...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm talking to you Red and I'm telling  you no. Get back to your position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabs him, desperate) Bob, I gotta bad feeling about this,  I... I'm telling you I got a bad  feeling, man, I don't think I'm gonna  make it... y'know what I mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) ...everybody gotta die sometime Red...  Get back to your foxhole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A look in his eyes. Very remote, very cold, silencing O'N Barnes walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the LZ, King runs out, gets on the last SUPPLY CHOPPER with some other men. It lifts off, swirling dust, the las rays of daylight. Chris watches from a Battalion CP area, waves back - the  chopper sound receding in the horizon, the comparative si of the jungle now creeping up on the perimeter. He turns starts back to his foxhole. A man is watching him. He's sitting on a sandbag, face in shadow. It startles Chris, something about him. Something different. A deep West Virginia drawl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got a light?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh sure...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goes over reluctantly, flicks his lighter, cupping it fro the wind. The flame catches a sudden, uneasy expression i Chris' face as he sees the Smoking Man. We come around and see what Chris sees in the light of th flame. A face that smiles at him like a death's head, a l ugly blister on his mouth, whiskered, pale - but smiling. sick man wouldn't smile like this, but he is smiling too  intimately, as if he knows Chris from way back. But he  doesn't. Or does he? Perhaps it was the man Chris first s at the airstrip when he came in-country. The same express of evil, of a man who has seen too much and died, but sti lives. Chris feels an unnatural fear passing through him. The Man stands, sucking on his cigarette, stretches. He i thin and very tall, towering over Chris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes. Chris watches him, wondering. The man never look back, a leisurely, confident stroll. In that moment, ther is an EXPLOSION from way out in the jungle, about a quart of a mile. Then another, then small arms fire. Chris look knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On his foxhole, Junior listening to the distant firing. B is introspective - talking to Junior as if he were his be friend, although they have nothing in common.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...y'know some of the things we done,  I don't feel like we done something  wrong but sometimes y'know I get  this bad feeling. Not all that shit  the Chaplain's jamming up our ass  'bout the Good Lord... just a fucking  bad feeling, y'know what I mean?  Don't know why. I told the Chaplain  the truth is I really like it here.  You do what you want, nobody fucks  with you. Only worry you got's dying  and if dat happens you won't know  about it anyway. So what the fuck... (chuckles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junior looks at him like he's really crazy. Back to the  distant firing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pissed now) Fuck! I gotta be on this hole with  YOU man. I just know I shouldna come!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bunny finds it funny, laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you worry bout a thing Junior,  you with Audie Murphy here, my man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the Company CP, Captain Harris is talking urgently int the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bravo Three Alpha! Send me a grid.  Send me a grid, over!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A young inexperienced VOICE screams back into the radio a intense background FIRING filtered by radio and sounding  disembodied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're pinned down sir, they're in  the fucking trees! The trees -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, Three Alpha, calm down now, son.   I'm gonna get you a fire mission  ASAP. Smoke'll be first...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (panic) Lieutenant's dead sir, radioman look  dead sir, I don't know where the map  is Captain! They're all around us  sir. They're moving! Hundreds of em!  I can hear em talking gook!!! Jesus  Christ!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calming him) ...Just spot the smoke son and tell  me where to shift. We'll get you out  of there. Just hang tough and tell  me where the rounds hit, over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the Platoon CP, Barnes stands, legs akimbo, watching t jungle, anticipating the coming fight as overhead we now  hear the 155 SHELLS whistle from a 10-mile distance - pas above them - then pounding down into the jungle in the ne distance. Barnes turns, glances at Wolfe, smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the Company CP, Captain Harris is back on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bravo Three Alpha six. How bout those  rounds son? Can you adjust fire? (waits) Three Alpha, if you can't talk, just  key the handset twice over. (waits) Silence, then a vague MURMURING -  becoming clearer and clearer. It's  in Vietnamese. The radio is then  bashed in, the sound like thunder in  the Captain's ear. He looks at his  RTO, both of them shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the Jungle itself, the ENEMY is moving. Flurries of  movement and sound, blurred visuals. Hands taping a piece cloth to a tree, moving on - revealing a luminous arrow  pointing left... Figures moving past it. Hands unraveling a thin wire waist-high, backwards. Hands sliding along another wire. We now see a moving hel with a luminous plaque on the back of it, leading a file the wire. To a Jump-off point about 50 yards outside the  U.S. perimeter. Figures crouch. Whispers. Movement. A pen flashlight on a drawing of the foxhole positions. The NVA moving out in several directions at once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On their foxhole, Chris and Francis wait anxiously. Overh the ARTILLERY keeps pounding into the ambush area. Now SM ARMS FIRE can be heard picking up at random spots along t perimeter. The battle, like a tide, is obviously moving c to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit me I wish I was back in  Memphis now, oooh baby this is gonna  be a motherfucker!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris says nothing. Suddenly off to their right, about 80 yards, a BLUE FIZZLE of light erupts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trip flares!... Rodriguez's hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rat-tat-tat-tat, rat-tat-tat. Machine gun, outgoing, foll by a sharp explosion. A ROCKET!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RPGs! Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crying) MEDIC!! DOC! DOC!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FIGURE thrashes up through the foliage behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a fierce whisper) Taylor! Francis!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhah jumps into their hole with them, out of breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhah! What's going on. Rodriguez's  hole just got...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gets his breath) Okay, here it is - one, we got gooks  in the fuckin' perimeter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit! Dat's it, dat's it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They got through Alpha Company!  Anything behind you don't identify  itself, blow it away. Two - air  strike's coming in. They gonna lay  snake and nape right on the perimeter  so stay tight in your holes and don't  leave 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLARES now shoot up over the perimeter. Reds, greens, yel squeaking as they float down on their parachute hinges  throughout the ensuing battle. The perimeter is illuminat at spotty intervals - sometimes arctic bright, sometimes  unexplainably dark til new flares shoot up. Chris, Francis, Rhah all look up at the light, and hug th holes even tighter, feeling naked in the light. Flares cu both ways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...they're probing us, they gonna go  up and down this line all night trying  to get through. Stay cool... I'll be  back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Runs out of the foxhole. Chris suddenly reacting to a noi out front, gripping Francis and pointing to the sound. A BODY is thrashing towards them, about twenty-five yards not yet visible but a little awkward and lungy in it's  movement, as if desperate. Francis, tense, is about to pop his grenade when Chris gr him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it! (loud whisper) WHO IS IT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the body keeps coming, lurching now, falling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A POP! - then a fizzle of BLUE LIGHT as the Figure hits t trip flare - revealing itself to be large, with no helmet and gasping, terrified of the trip flare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DON'T SHOOT! DON'T SHOOT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the ambush! (calling out) In here, man! Hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SOLDIER now runs in like a fullback going down for th tackle, sprawling into the hole, knocking Chris and Franc down beneath him. He is sweating, terrified, a white boy with an unrecogniz filthy face, no rifle, no helmet, his fatigues torn all o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water! Water!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris gives him his canteen, his shoulder and neck hurtin from the collision. The Soldier sucks down the canteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (between gulps) They'se all over the place, hundreds  of em moving this way! They wiped us  out man, we didn't have a chance!  Where's the CP?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points) Back there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Soldier struggling out of the foxhole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys get outta here! They're  right on my ass and they ain't  stoppin' for shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tears off, leaving Francis in a state of incipient pan He looks at Chris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taylor, let's di-di man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris adjusting position, facing the front, anger in his  voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Francis hesitates, stays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the Battalion CP, the Major is inside his BUNKER, busy between his radio nets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to RTO 1) Get me Bravo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie Company reports hand to hand  on the perimeter sir. Three holes  are down. They need help!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at his watch,  to his XO) Okay move two squads from Alpha down  there. Where's that goddamn air  strike, you bet your ass if we were  the First Cav they'd be here now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (handing him the  transmitter) Bravo Six sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just outside the Bunker, a MASTER SERGEANT spots somethin in the flarelight. TWO FIGURES with helmets running towar him at an angle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey you boys! Which Company you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sudden burst of FIRE cuts the Sergeant down in his trac and the Figures fly by. Soldiers in the immediate area spot them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAPPERS!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BUNKER!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A burst of fire. One of the RUNNING FIGURES goes down. An Explosion engulfs him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the SECOND SAPPER runs right into the bunker in a kam charge, the light from inside momentarily revealing a bul satchel strapped on his person and the face of the astoun Major.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIR!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bunker EXPLODES with a deafening roar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In their foxhole, Chris and Francis look at the curling b of flame, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In their foxhole, Chris points.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHAPES moving in the trees. Chris blows his claymore hand One explosion on top of the other out front. Then return  fire. Flashes from a muzzle, rak-a-tak, rak-a-tak, rak-a- tak, the heavier sound of an AK-47. Chris opening up with his 16. Then being blown down by a  grenade explosion at the edge of the foxhole. Then nothin A pause. Chris' ears ringing, slightly concussed. Suddenly from down the perimeter there is the sound of a  faulty LOUDSPEAKER crackling out from the jungle. A pidge English, the words mauled, then a snatch of patriotic Nor Vietnamese music, played from a scratchy old record. Chris uneasy, looking at Francis who looks terrified. The SOUND now of a whistle. Two hoots, then a sharp third. Th yelling. Chris grabbing Francis' arm, pointing. There is a VOICE  directly out to the front of them - muttering something i Vietnamese, no more than 20 yards away but unseen. It's l hearing a casual conversation from another room, then the sounds of several bodies moving in separate directions -  encompassing the foxhole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Francis, a whisper) Out of the hole! Fast!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris crawls out, stops, looks back. Francis won't leave, hugs the shelter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a fierce whisper) Goddamit Francis! Move your fucking  ass. Now... THEY GONNA BLOW IT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reaches in and yanks him with all his strength half out o the hole. Francis, finally sparked, now moves out. Both o them bellying it into the brush behind the hole. Not a moment too soon. An RPG ROCKET whistling in. The FOXHOLE takes a direct hit, caving in, whirls of smok spinning off it. Chris and Francis look back covered with debris. They hea movement. SHADOWS are swarming towards the foxhole, firing into it finish them off. Francis grabs Chris' leg, indicating they get out of ther Chris hesitates - a moment, a decision made now in angry  passion - rises up and charges the NVA. SHADOWS scatter and tumble, caught by his surprise close- range fire. Chris moving forward into them, blasting, agile, his inst finely tuned, and totally insane in this moment of time,  indifferent to his life. He YELLS insanities, pumping him up with the adrenaline of courage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DIE YOU MOTHERFUCKERS!!! YAAAAAAAAA!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screams from the dark shadows, they fall. Chris smashing a wounded SHADOW with the butt of his gun  down into the foxhole. He jumps back into it, reoccupying it. Blasting the dead gook. Opening fire out to the front, driving the Shadows back. Francis watching this, amazed. After a moment of doubt, h too tears back out to join Chris in the foxhole, unbeliev as he jumps in with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (joining in the frenzy) YAAAAAHHHH!!!! KILLLLL!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then stunned again to see Chris suddenly rise up out of t foxhole and charging forward into the jungle. He is now o the edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (charging off into  the jungle) DIE YOU MOTHERFUCKERS!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In his position, Bunny is experiencing the same 'high' as Chris, yells out at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on MOTHERFUCKERS, COME ON!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junior, huddled in the hole with him, speechless and  terrified, looks at him with huge eyes. The guy is nuts. incoming grenade explosion shakes the hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laying out more fire) Come on you can do better than that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck this shit! I ain't dyin' in no  white man's war! Ise didi-ing this  motherfuckah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junior freaks out, throws his rifle down and hobbles out the hole on his damaged feet at an incredible speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling after him) Get back here you gutless shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SHAPE suddenly out of nowhere, looms up fast behind Bun running at him. Junior, insane now with fear, runs smack into a tree, kno senseless and reeling to the ground. Bunny turning back too late. The crazy drug-high Shape is yelling something like:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diiiiikaaeeeeeee!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And jumps right into the hole blasting Bunny point-blank the chest. Bunny struggling to consciousness at the bottom of the ho THUCK! A boot in the gaping hole where his chest was. Bun his eyes uncomprehending. A muzzle is jammed into his mou breaking his teeth with an ugly sound. Another yell from NVA trooper. A flash of orange red light. Bunny's face bl to bits. Junior, dizzy from the blow to his head, looks up. A yellow flare somewhere out there and a SHADOW above him digging a bayonet into his belly with a grunt. A long ooz sigh of belly gas. An explosion. The Shadow with the bayonet staggering blin without eyes, holding his brains with his hands. Barnes throws open the empty LAAW rocket casing he has ju fired off and charges forward with a yell, cutting down  another NVA in Bunny's old foxhole. Jumping into the hole the bottom of which is a liquid pit of guts, blood, ooze. Another Enemy running in on him. A short burst of fire. B hit. Firing into each other. Barnes draggin him down into the pit with him, grappling alongside the corpse of Bunny Barnes uses an entrenching tool to finish him off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the Platoon CP, small arms fire is all over the place, the NVA closing the ring. Ace, in the foxhole, yells to W

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative contact. Can't raise Barnes,  Two Bravo, Two Charlie, nothin'!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me Six!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nervously aiming his rifle as a man comes running towards them, staggering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Doc!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc plops down, out of breath, drained, bleeding all over his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're coming through all over! I  can't... I can't do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Barnes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he's dead... it's awful,  they're all dying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wolfe is stunned, Barnes his last crutch against the chao Ace handing him the handset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah! Send traffic or clear this  goddamn net!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been overrun Captain, we're  pulling back. Over!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the Company CP, things are just as bad. A Radioman is  sprawled over a smashed radio. Captain Harris is in a bun working the radios himself, as his Radiomen fire at yelli running FIGURES scurrying all over the inner perimeter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (furious voice) Bravo Two, Six! Goddamit where the  hell you plannin' to pull back to!  They're all over the perimeter. Be  advised Lieutenant, you WILL hold in  place and you will FIGHT and that  means YOU, Lieutenant. Out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the Platoon CP, Wolfe is astounded by the message. Ace looking at him straight in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're an asshole Lieutenant, you  know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he abandons his radio, grabs up his 16 and moves to an adjacent position. Doc, a quiet man up to now, is treatin wounded Parker who is now hit by bullets and thrashes wil and jerks to a stop. He is obviously dead but Doc goes on trying to finish the bandage. Suddenly he goes beserk, gr a 16, starts firing and yelling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the Company CP, Harris gets on the radio with the air  strike. One of the RTOs on a separate radio calls over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, Third Battalion Armoured's  on its way with tracks 'bout 2 kliks  west!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignores it, into  radio) Snakebite leader, Ripper Bravo Six,  we're gonna need you soonest be  advised I've got zips in the wire  down here, over!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (distorted high  frequency) Roger your last Bravo Six, Snakebite  lead we can't run it any closer.  We're hot to trot and packing snape  and nape but we're bingo fuel. It's  your call, Six actual, Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harris looks around. The decision made.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snakebite leader, Bravo Six, for the  record, it's my call. Dump everything  you got left ON MY POS. I say again,  I want all you're holding INSIDE the  perimeter. It's a lovely war. Bravo  Six Actual and Out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pilot's reaction. Very calm. A Farmboy twang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger your last Bravo Six. We copy  it's your call. Get em in their holes  down there. Hang tough, Bravo Six we  are coming cocked for treetops.  Whiskey to Echo... Snakebite Two,  this is lead. Last pass on zero niner.  Watch my smoke to target, expend all  remaining. Follow my trace...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
