dialogues.text: The transmission drops out. Harris now looking up into th darkened skies. The planes in no way evident - but they'r there. And they're coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the Platoon CP, the NVA are sweeping fast, crouched, u cover, yelling. Small fires are raging all over the perim Ace putting out fire, is hit. The NVA are coming over his sandbags. A burst of fire. Ace goes down. Doc has cracked up, firing at anything, indifferent to hi safety. One of the NVA goes down. The Doc is hit in the s wounded, struggles, is hit again, but keeps trying to fir He's hit a third time - in the jugular vein. Nearby, Wolf is firing madly at the oncoming NVA. One goes down. A sec is wounded, yelling in pain. Wolfe reloading his 16, popp up, too late. One of them is coming over the sandbags. He sees Wolfe. Wolfe sees him. In the same moment. Wolfe hesitates, frozen up. The gook unloads his AK-47, a magazine worth, into Lieutenant Wolfe, who crashes down,  sprawled unnaturally on the jungle floor. A spasm shakes body. Then stops. Dead. Boots run by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At his foxhole, O'Neill peeks up out of the hole. Several NVA are darting through the jungle 20 yards away, coming  towards him, talking loudly to each other. He quickly sli back down in the hole, entwining himself with the approac NVA, clinking metal. The NVA stop, glance in the hole. Something is muttered.  They run out. O'Neill opens his eyes, breathes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARNES swings his mashed M-16 full into the FACE of an en SOLDIER who screams and goes down, Barnes chopping at him with his club. His helmet is gone, his shirt ripped to sh his shoulder bleeding, making his last stand against the  hated Gooks. Nearby HUFFMEISTER is hit in the shoulder by a running FI and collapses into the bottom of the foxhole, crying out pain. The running FIGURE runs past right into the full force of BARNES' swinging rifle. SMACK! He crumples.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris bellies into the area, see Barnes, recognizes him,  amazed. An ENEMY fires, taking Barnes high in the left thigh. A p of skin blowing off. Barnes rigidly goes down on his left knee like a wounded horse. Holds there, staring into the  Enemy, waiting for the coup de grace. A series of SHOUTS and the Enemy staggers dead as: Chris lays out a curtain of fire. A GRENADE goes off near him, blowing off his helmet. Dazed, Chris rushes forward  firing from the hip - sucked into Barnes' suicidal vacuum He cuts down an Enemy as: Barnes, given a new lease, limps angrily forward and tack a wounded Enemy trying to crawl away, terrified at the si of Barnes coming after him. Barnes lets out a vivid screa And beats the soldier mercilessly, half the stock of his 16 flying apart broken. Chris swivels alert on his knees. A pause. No more enemy. Turns to Barnes, his back to Chris still beating at the d corpse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnes swivels instinctively off the corpse and for a  petrifying moment Chris sees: A maddened scar of a face, lips specked with foam. The EY refracted in a red-green flare overhead - the pupils dist into angry red points. For Chris it is no doubt the most frightening single imag he has seen in his life. It will be in his nightmares for The essence of evil: wrath, obsession, anger, fear, hatre permanence - he is paralyzed. Barnes smashes him full across the face with the broken s of his M-16. Not even consciously, for at this point, his mind has gone over the edge and the entire world is his e American or Vietnamese, it makes no difference as he stri Chris harder and harder. Chris struggles, moans, his teeth and nose cracked. Barne emits another chilling yell an springs like a humpback up his good right leg, the left bent - set to deliver the ki blow, the mangled rifle pulled to its highest arc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nooooooooo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PHANTOM FIGHTER JET comes now like a great white whal One big beautiful monstrous beat of deafening sound. Its  silver and white belly hurtling low over the treeline in giant leap of sound momentarily illuminated by a flare. T a monstrous ROAR of anger. The bomb ripping Barnes off the body of Chris and spittin Chris across the jungle floor - crashing into a tree some yards away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FADE BACK IN. Vague sunlight. Blurry. Chris fluttering hi eyes. A sharp MOVEMENT in the bush. His eyes fight their open. SOFT EYES are watching him from behind foliage. A soft, f head, alert, rigidly still. Chris fights his way up to his elbow, in pain, looking at the eyes. The head turns and in one fluid move, bolts. Go Like the wind. A deer. A big brown deer. Or was it? Chris will never be quite sure. But whatever it was, it was sur a sign of grace - the grace of Elias. This he knows as he feels himself for the first time alive. And in pain. His left hand torn and bleeding, shrapnel in his side, cuts on his face, dried blood caking him. Looki around his garden of eden. A messy jungle floor. Cordite  fumes. Burned bush and trees. Torn sandbags. Dead NVA. Bi songs somewhere in the distance. It is the very crack of  dawn, a pink-red sun casting long oblique light patterns  through the trees. A holy light. Chris pushes himself to his feet, feels his weight and th pain. He walks. In the near distance, towards the LZ area there's the sound of Armored Personnel carriers grinding, men moving, calling out in Americanese. But Chris is alon here. He fishes up an AK-47 from a dead NVA. Checks it, a weapo Walks on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Past scores of NVA bodies. Past the Foxhole where Bunny l dead in the bottom, faceless. Looking over at Junior bayo to the ground, dead. NVA everywhere around the hole, some them still moving, badly wounded. Chris looking around, then noticing a movement a little  further out in the Jungle. Then he sees who. The uniform is shredded, the figure obviously hurt in sev places (thigh, back, neck, hand) but not mortally so, now struggling to right itself, dragging its face up from a b down position. Streaked with dirt and blood, we see Barne once again re-emerging from the dead. Chris steps over to him, a solemn look on his face. Barne looks up, begs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me a Medic will ya. Go on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris doesn't move. Barnes looks at him again, reading th intention that has crossed Chris' mind. An expression of  surprise crosses his face, then amazement, almost shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you in hell...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris shoots him. Once. Twice. Three times. Silence... Barnes is finally dead. Chris looking at the corpse, numbed, no exultation in his expression. Just cold satisfaction and little feeling lef Behind him, the SOUND of a big machine moving. He turns. A huge Nazi flag on an antenna looms up in the bush, foll by the great belly of a turreted dragon crunching down a  tree for its breakfast. A big tough GERMAN SHEPARD comes boudning at him sniffs,  followed by a flak-jacketed MONSTER MAN - filthy and grea unshaven face, earring in his left ear, 'DEATH CORPS' scr on his shirtless flak jacket and a drawing of a death's h he looks like a cross between a pirate and a hell's angel Behind him, a SECOND MONSTER MAN and the ARMORED PERSONNE CARRIER grinding its engine, a human skull hanging from i turret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Dog) Bozo! Get back here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes passing on Chris like so much meat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Chris) Can you walk outta here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris nods. The Soldier pointing to the LZ behind him as sign he should go that way. The other Soldier already  stripping the NVA dead, as the APC grinds on into the jun reconnoitering. Chris walks out of the jungle, head bowed, nauseated, mix feelings roiling him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In another foxhole, Francis waits, the sounds of the  approaching APC cutting through. He thinks about it a mom It must be fast. It must be a hard cold decision. Now! He pulls out his K-bar and with one last anguished hesita drives it into his thigh muscle. Francis yells out and collapses in his hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In another foxhole, O'Neill, unscratched but covered with dirt, waits tentatively as SOLDIERS arrive at his hole.  They're a little awed by the sight of the tough-looking  O'Neill emerging from his foxhole like Sgt. Rock, dozens dead NVA littered around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You alone Sarge?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck yeah. They all left me, bunch  of fuckin' faggots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, you gonna get yoself a silver  star.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck the silver star. You got any  booze?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhah, alive and well, is poking around the NVA corpses wi a long gnarled walking stick, looking like a crazy Johnny Appleseed with his pants rolled up on his thin hairy ankl and wearing a red bandana tied in a four-knot around his  head. As one of the APC SOLDIERS carves an ear off a dead NVA,  Rhah works his way through the torn bloody pocket of an N Troop in full rigor mortis, extracting what he thought wa there - a wrapped cellophane of heroin. Rhah's face glows with satisfaction as he tastes it, then snorts it. With a certain satisfaction of triumph over th grim circumstances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the powder) Yeah, that's good shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS is hauled out on a litter. Morphined, his eyes watc it all from somewhere deep in his brain. Passing: Groups of SOLDIERS looking like bowery bums and moving li rats through the smoke and garbage snooping for souvenirs with wheezy tired eyes and grunts of greed. Passing a bulldozed PIT with heaps of NVA BODIES in them. BULLDOZER pushing another set of bodies in, like photos o Nazi death camp. Nearby, two burly SOLDIERS lift a WOMAN NURSE and with a  once-through build for momentum, toss the fresh body into the pit. Chris, numb, goes by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio, exhausted) U.S. KIA, 122 wounded and still  counting. Estimate 500 Victor Charlie  KIA, 22 wounded and still counting.  Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, a television crew's coming in  with the General -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAPTAIN HARRIS doesn't respond; at this point he doesn't  give a shit, standing apart from the radios looking numbl at the remnants of his boys filtering by on litters. Chris intersects him now, Harris' eyes looking blankly, t nodding sickly trying to give him encouragement. Just com to the edge of tears, choking it back, and turning back.  These are his sons who are lost. A good officer. Rodriguez, wounded, is lifted up in his litter and moved to the waiting MEDIVAC CHOPPER, a huge red cross painted a white square. Doc goes by on another litter, then Ace, Adams, Huffmeist etc. Then Francis is littered by, bandages around his leg, a b smile on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Taylor, you okay man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. How 'bout you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jes' fine man, jes fine! Ain't never  felt better! Both of us two timers  man, we're out. (gives him a slap as  he goes by) See you at the hospital man, we gonna  get high-high yessir... (goes off)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Medic points to the chopper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Chris) That's your ride man, you ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tries a smile) You bet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris starts towards it, the Medic assisting him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sgt. O'Neill watches the loading process forlornly from t distance. Captain Harris intersects him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got Second Platoon Sergeant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reflexively) Yes sir -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as Harris moves away, O'Neill is left thinking. Final there is a certain frustration to his actions; he has tak such great pains to stay alive that the tuition he pays i precisely to stay in this Jungle. Inevitably his time wil come - one way or another. His eyes now follow the MEDIVAC CHOPPER upwards, whatever left of his shrunken soul yearning to go with it.

dialogues.speaker: EXT/INT
dialogues.text: As the Chopper rises off the battlefield, Chris, who is  sitting at the edge so that he has a full view out the op door, waves back at Rhah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhah, at the edge of the treeline, vigorously shakes his  walking stick at him, his other hand a fist, waving them, emitting his cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baaaaaaaaa!!!!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Defiance. Pride. Dig me, I'm Rhah - and there isn't nobod like me in the world.

dialogues.speaker: EXT/INT
dialogues.text: The chopper - with its huge red cross painted on - now ri to meet God. Smashed on morphine, Chris looking out at th waving ants below. Now the trees, the skyline and the chopper is moving fast over the devastation. The jungle forever locked in his me Chris looks back, copious, quiet tears flowing from his e

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think now, looking back, we did  not fight the enemy, we fought  ourselves - and the enemy was in  us... The war is over for me now,  but it will always be there - the  rest of my days. As I am sure Elias  will be - fighting with Barnes for  what Rhah called possession of my  soul... There are times since I have  felt like the child born of those  two fathers... but be that as it  may, those of us who did make it  have an obligation to build again,  to teach to others what we know and  to try with what's left of our lives  to find a goodness and meaning to  this life...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The music surges now to its full strength as we replay bi of film with each actor's name listed - some with silly,  clowning looks, others sober, haunted. Gardner, Tex, King Rhah, Lerner, Sanderson, Manny, Big Harold - all the boys and then Barnes staring quietly into the camera, and last Elias - shirt off, bowl of grass in hand, his big, beauti smile.
